loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri is 62 years old and lives with his wife and children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. 

His wife helps with his business. His elder son is an entrepreneur and the younger one is a clerk at the grocery shop. 

Batsuuri operates a water sales business. He started his business in 2006 by delivering water by his carriage. Now he owns a pick-up truck and has many regular customers such as cafes, kindergartens and schools. 

He is a hard-working and diligent man who says, "I started my business from a scratch. I am very confident that my business will expand."

He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to repair his pick-up truck.

loans.use: To repair his pick-up truck.

loans.name: Raida

texts.en:
Raida is 43 years old and married with 5 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Raida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Raida has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 51 years old and married with 8 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Shirly is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Shirly has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from a computer shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cerro Verde Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Cerro Verde, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Limpia. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con 11 integrantes. El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; son muy trabajadoras. A través del Comité ellas quieren lograr una vida digna para sus familias. Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y de escasos recursos.
Maria, es una de las miembros, ella tiene una peluquería, la cual explota desde hace ya un buen tiempo, tiene muy variada clientela que siempre acuden a ella, ya sea hombres y mujeres. Tiene buen ingreso, lo que le ayuda a poder cubrir los gastos del negocio y de su casa. Le gustaría poder continuar con su negocio, por lo cual solicita el préstamo a la fundación, es decir para la compra de tijeras, gel, tintes, y algunos químicos necesarios para la peluquería, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Cerro Verde was formed through the initiative of Señora Limpia. Currently they are in their 1st loan cycle with 11 members. When the group started it demonstrated unity and solidarity between the members; they are very hardworking. Through the Comité, they want a decent life for their families. They are all self-sacrificing women of limited means.

Maria is one of the members. She has a hairdressing salon which she has run for a very long time. She has a varied clientele which are loyal to her, whether they be men or women. She has a good income which helps her cover both business and household expenses. She would like to continue with her business and for this reason she is asking the Fundacion for a loan to buy scissors, dyes, gel, and chemicals necessary for a hairdressing salon, so as to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy scissors, dyes, gels  and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an invented trailer to start running his new business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 43 years old, married with three children and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines which she has been running for five years. She also earns an income from e-loading and selling frozen foods. 

She has requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to her customers. She has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rosalie aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more wool materials.

loans.name: Sonia Elba

texts.es: Sonia Elba D. cuarenta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una pupuseria que es muy conocida en la localidad, pues prepara unas pupusas exquisitas, revueltas, D. queso, chicharrón etc. Todo con material D. calidad y a un buen precio, además el lugar donD. las venD. es muy higiénico; Sonia es una mujer entregada a su trabajo siempre está dispuesta a aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan ella piensa que para triunfar hace falta solamente la voluntad D. llegar a la cima, y Sonia tiene la voluntad por delante, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar chicharrón, queso, frijoles, maíz, harina D. arroz, tomates etc. Sonia Elba tiene la confianza que con su esfuerzo lograra darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Sonia Elba is 45 years old and lives with her spouse and children.  She has a pupusa shop that’s very well known in her community because she prepares exquisite revueltas, cheese, pork, etc. pupusas. [The two most common pupusas are the pupusa D. queso (cheese) and more popular pupusa revuelta with mixed ingredients of queso (cheese), frijoles (beans),and chicharrón. Pupusas are typically served with curtido (lightly fermented cabbage slaw with red chilies and vinegar) and a watery tomato salsa.]  

All of her ingredients are good quality and her prices are affordable.  Besides, the place she sells them at is very hygienic.  Sonia is a woman who is dedicated to her work; she’s always ready to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves.  She thinks that to be successful all one needs is the will to reach the top and Sonia has will to spare.  This is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour, tomatoes, etc.  Sonia Elba is confident that with her efforts she’ll be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour and tomatoes.

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en: Lorm is 34 years old with two children. Her youngest child is still in school. She started farming 10 years ago. She requested her first loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer and to plow her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield to earn more income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es: Reina Esperanza vive con sus hijos los cuales todavía asisten a la escuela, ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de donde residen, tiene su puesto en un punto estratégico del mercado es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela, además de que las frutas y verduras que vende son frescas y de muy buena calidad; Reina es una mujer muy trabajadora y le gusta mantenerse adelante de la competencia, para ella todo viaje, por largo que sea empieza por un solo paso, ella quiere emprender su viaje y hacer crecer su negocio, por eso se decidió a dar el paso y solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar naranjas, mandarinas, plátanos, piñas, tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas entre otros. Reina Esperanza tiene la confianza que de esta forma lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Reina Esperanza lives with her children who are still going to school.  She sells fruit and vegetables in the municipal market where they live.  She has her stand located in a strategic spot in the market so she has many customers.  Besides, the fruit and vegetables she sells are fresh and of very good quality.  Reina is a very hardworking woman who likes to stay ahead of the competition.  For her, every trip, no matter how long, starts with a single step.  She wants to undertake her trip and make her business grow.  That’s why she decided to take that first step and ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy oranges, mandarins, bananas, pineapples, tomatoes, onions, chilies and potatoes, among others.  Reina Esperanza is confident that she will bring economic security to her home this way.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya, con un total D. 10 integrantes. Han demostrado unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen cada una, una actividad económica y son muy trabajadoras. Ellas desean un mejor porvenir para todas sus familias e hijos.
Fatima, una D. las miembros se dedica a la cría y posterior venta D. animales, oficio que ella describe como muy sacrificado, ya que requiere D. mucho esfuerzo no solo físico, sino también mental. Dice que los animales deben D. ser atendidos siempre, para que los mismos no tengan enfermedades u otro tipo D. problemas. Sueña con poder tener una granja con muchos animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. animales pequeños para la cría y también balanceado para ellos. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Unidas" is currently in its 1st loan cycle of the program for enterprising women of the Fundación Paraguaya, witth a total of 10 members. They have demonstrated unity and solidarity amongst the members, each of which owns a business and is very hardworking. They want a better future for their families and children.

Fatima, one of the members, breeds and sells animals, a job she describes as being very self-sacrificing as it requires a lot of physical and mental effort. She says that the animals need constant attention so that they do not contract diseases or other problems. She dreams of having a farm with a lot of animals.

She is asking for the loan to buy young animals for breeding and also balanced feed for them. She is thankful to the Fundación and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: o buy animals for breeding and the relevant feed.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is 31 years old. She is a single mother with two children.

Berna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Berna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Berna hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Vilma Jeannette

texts.es: Vilma Jeannette, reside en casa propia en uno de los municipios del gran San Salvador en área urbana, junto a su grupo familiar conformado por tres hijos: Neri, Jefferson, Julio todos se encuentra estudiando en la escuela grados inferiores al bachillerato y su esposo que trabaja como empleado público y con ello tiene a su cargo el sostenimiento del hogar. Vilma desde hace muchos años decidió colaborar económicamente estableciendo en su misma casa una tienda donde vende ropa y zapatos, aprovechando que se considera una mujer con muy buenos gustos para vestir y buena administradora, ya son varios años de dedicarse a este negocio apoyada con financiamientos y gracias a ello su hogar goza de condiciones necesarias para vivir. Vilma es previsora y desea anticiparse a comprar nueva ropa como blusas, faldas, camisas y zapatos de moda para la próxima temporada de diciembre a sabiendas de que sus clientes la empezarán a buscar. Dicha época del año siempre es muy rentable para Vilma y espera poder contar con la ayuda de INTEGRAL para no dejar pasar la oportunidad de hacer buenos negocios
texts.en:
Vilma Jeannette lives in her own house in one of the towns in the greater San Salvador urban area with her family composed of three children: Neri, Jefferson and Julio who are all in school in grades from elementary to high school and her husband who works as a public employee and is in charge of supporting the family.

Many years ago Vilma decided to help economically setting up a clothing and shoe store in her house.  She took advantage of the fact that she considers herself to have very good taste with respect to attire and she’s a good businesswoman.  She’s been in business for many years now with help from loans and thanks to it her home enjoys the conditions necessary to live.  

Vilma is forward thinking so she wants to get ahead of things and buy new clothes like blouses, skirts, shirts and shoes in next season’s styles to be ready for December knowing that her customers will start to look for it.  That time of year is always very profitable for Vilma and she hopes to have support from INTEGRAL so that this opportunity for good business won’t escape her.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mónica Carolina

texts.es: Mónica Carolina de veintiocho años de edad vive con su compañero de vida. Ella posee una venta de mariscos en el mercado de su localidad se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues es muy buena vendedora y lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad, producto fresco, limpio y por supuesto a precios realmente accesibles; Mónica Carolina es una mujer entregada a su trabajo se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar la venta de cada día en el mercado; para ella uno de los secretos del éxito es no permitir que los contratiempos pasajeros nos derroten, es por eso que ella le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mariscos de todo tipo lonja, pescado, camarón entre otros. Mónica Carolina tiene fe que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mónica Carolina is 28, and lives with her life partner. She owns a fish stall in the local market. She has acquired a lot of customers, as she is a very good saleswoman, and what she sells is of very good quality: fresh, clean, and of course, sold at really affordable prices. 

Mónica Carolina is a woman very devoted to her work, who gets up very early to prepare for each day's sale at the market. 

For her, one of the secrets of success is not allowing passing setbacks to defeat her. That's why she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seafood of all types, fish, fish filets, shrimp, and other products. 

Mónica Carolina has faith that in this way, she will succeed in giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fish, fish filets, and shrimp.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina, married with eight children, is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. Together with her spouse, she has a business hauling plastics and other recyclables to sell in the village, usually earning an income of P2,000 monthly. While all of Adelina's children are already married and live on their own, they help her in times of need. She doesn't want to rely on their remittances, which that is why she involved in this business.

Adelina is now requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy more used bottles, plastics and newpapers to sell. She wants to strengthen her business to save enough money to use in times of emergency, especially as they are growing older and weaker.

loans.use: to buy more used bottles, plastics and newpapers to sell.

loans.name: Mandahtuya

texts.en: Mandahtuya is a 49-year-old widow who lives with her children in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her oldest son works in a mining company, while she earns a living by selling groceries. She started her business in 1989 by renting a counter in local market, and now runs a retail business in the same area. She is doing well and is very experienced in her field. She would like to begin selling goods that she gets from China and believes that she can do this because she is a strong and diligent woman whose children are now grown and independent. She is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 MNT to buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old. She is married with two children.

Catherine has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Catherine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,Catherine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell, like snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hermandad Group

texts.es:
"Hermandad" se encuentra actualmente en el primer ciclo, contando con 11 integrantes. Este comité se forma gracias a una de las miembros del grupo que oyó hablar acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación, por lo que se informó y junto a sus vecinas y amigas, las cuales gustosas decidieron integrar el comité.
Un ejemplo de ellas es la señora Rosa, la cual se dedica a la elaboración y posterior venta de alimentos de todo tipo. Dice que su jornada laboral empieza a muy tempranas horas del día, que es cuando prepara sus alimentos y termina ya muy tarde. Comenta que siempre tiene muchos pedidos de sus comidas, pues tiene muy buena sazón. Por estos motivos ella quiere seguir trabajando en esto que le gusta mucho y es por eso que solicita el crédito, para la compra de carne, pollo, condimentos, panificados y demás, los cuales son ingredientes necesarios para sus alimentos.
texts.en:
"Hermandad" is currently in its 1st loan cycle and has 11 members. This group was formed thanks to one of the members of the group hearing about the Fundacion's program for enterprising women. She obtained the relevant information and gathered her friends and neighbours who were delighted and decided to form the group.

Point in case is Señora Rosa who sells all kinds of food. She says that her working day starts very early in the morning which is when she prepares her food and ends very late. She says that she always has a lot of orders for her food, as it tastes very good. For these reasons, she wants to continue with the business as she likes it a lot which is why she is asking for a loan to buy meat, chicken, seasonings, bread and so on as they are necessary ingredients for her food.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, seasonings and other products to prepare food.

loans.name: Verbina

texts.en:
Verbina is 36 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.

Verbina works in the fish industry and sells dried fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has been requested a loan of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase dried fish to sell.

Verbina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Verbina hopes to become a supplier of dried fish in the province.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Mrs. Sos is a good housewife and a good mother who always educates and takes care of her children at home. She is married to Mr. Math who works as a construction foreman. Her main income is from her husband who yields a profit of $8 per day from his business. Two of her children are now working; her daughter is a garment factory worker and her son is a construction worker in the field with his father. Even though Mrs. Sos doesn’t work outside the home or earn any income for her family, she often helps give good suggestions to her husband in order to improve their standard of living. 

Sometimes there is no work to do at the construction field, so Mrs. Sos thinks that her husband should use that time to do other work that can produce money. She wants to buy a tuk-tuk (three-wheeler vehicle) for her husband so he can start providing service for more profit when he is free. Thus, Mrs. Sos is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a tuk-tuk to support her husband’s new business. In the future, she plans to fix her old house and save some money for the future growth and enlargement of her family’s business.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk-tuk (three-wheeler vehicle) to support her husband’s new business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 22 years old. She is married with one child.

Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested  a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages and develop her store into a bigger one.

Elizabeth a has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elizabeth  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her motorcycle shop business.

Mary Rose has been in this business for seven years. Mary Rose earns more income from raising pigs.

Mary Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her motorcycle shop business.

loans.name: Ma. Rosie

texts.en:
Ma. Rosie is 42 years old and is married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Rosie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Rosie has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from food vending and direct selling.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old and is married with six children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Myrna has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
"Mujeres Activas", se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Adelaida. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de la Fundación Paraguaya, con once integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperación, y comprensión. Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas, y de escasos recursos, por lo que ven el comité una gran oportunidad de crecimiento.
Candelaria se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de cerdos, este es su medio principal de ingresos, por lo que trabaja arduamente. comenta que siempre tiene comprador para sus animales, lo cual le es de mucha ayuda. Ella se considera una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada, ya que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia y el de ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos pequeños para la cría, como así también para la compra de balanceados para dichos animales.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Activas" (Active Women) formed at the initiative of Señora Adelaida. Currently, it is in its first cycle of Fundación Paraguaya’s program. It has 11 members, all of who work in an environment of cooperation and understanding. They are all self-sacrificing women with scarce resources, which is why they see the group as a big opportunity for increasing their income.

Candelaria is engaged in raising, and then selling, pigs. This is her principal source of income, which is why she works very hard. She says that she always has buyers for her animals, which is a big help. She is considered a very hardworking and self-sacrificing woman since everything she does is for the wellbeing of her family as well as herself. She is applying for the loan for the purchase of small pigs ,which she will raise, and to purchase balanced feed for these animals.

loans.use: to purchase small pigs to raise and to purchase balanced feed for these animals.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending, farming sugarcane and rice, and through a general store. Analyn is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance for her transport business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 12 children, Cynthia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from wholeselling/retailing crablets. 

Cynthia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Cynthia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Altantuul

texts.en: Altantuul, 40, lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works at a construction site, her two elder children are college students and her younger child goes to kindergarden. She started her grocery retail business in 1999 by renting a counter in the market. Her daily income is 100,000 - 150,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). She is well known for her fresh groceries. Now that winter is arriving, she needs to buy a mass amount of vegetables and save them, as during the winter the vegetable prices will increase. She will avoid this problem by saving them. She is therefore requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 52 years old and married.

Shirley works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading and farming rice. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Shirley has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan.

Shirley aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en:
Solongo, 33, is a taxi driver trying to save money for her son’s future education. She lives with her sick mother and her son in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Solongo has been running her business since 2007 and has gained a lot of experience during this period. She is actually a business manager but has still not worked in this occupation as there are no positions available with companies. Her taxi service is therefore the main source of income for her family.

Lately, Solongo's car has started to break down, making it dangerous to serve customers. Therefore, she needs to change some parts and sections of the car. It will be beneficial for her business earnings if she can make these repairs before this winter. The loan Solongo is requesting will used to purchase the new parts for her taxi car and to make the repairs on it.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts for her taxi car in order to repair it.

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda, 63, is married with four children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more stock for her store.

Wenefreda has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sulficia

texts.en:
Sulficia works hard to support her family. Sulficia is a widow and she has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Sulficia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a motor for her fishing boat.

Sulficia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Sulficia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling of sun-dried fish business in the Philippines. Gina has been in this business for 20 years. 
Gina earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more fish for her dried fish business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Krishna Maya is 33 years old. She is married and has two children, age 11 and 9.  

In 2001, she established  her cow's milk selling business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys a young milk-giving cow.  

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires, and it can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over. 

In the future, Krishna Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has an entertainment (videoke) business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a coffee shop. 

Josefina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her entertainment business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy an additional unit for her business.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren, 38, lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife looks after their  youngest daughter at home and the elder two go to school.

Byambasuren started his business in 2002 by purchasing his own van for a transportation business. His business is sustainable. Now that winter is approaching, he needs to replace and repair the van's engine. He is a strong and diligent man who says, "I love my work and I have a vision that someday I could buy a truck." He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to replace his van's engine.

loans.use: to replace his van's engine.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, 43, is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susana has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Susana has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en:
Oyunbat, 26, is a taxi driver and lives alone. He runs his taxi business around the districts of Ulaanbatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is also a college student and the taxi service is his main source of income. 

Lately, his car is having some breakdowns, making it dangerous to serve customers. Therefore, he needs to change some parts and sections. It will be beneficial for his business earnings if he can make these repairs before winter. The loan Oyunbat is requesting will be used to purchase the new parts for his taxi car and to make the repairs to it.

loans.use: to purchase new parts for his taxi car and to make repairs to it.

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
La señorita Zunilda tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un hijo que es menor y que depende de ella. Vive con su mamá en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Es artesana, desde muy joven se dedica a tejer, lo que le deja un buen ingreso, dicha profesión lo aprendió de su mamá que le enseñaba desde que ella tiene memoria. Hace 20 años que teje. Comenta que tiene muy buenas manos para las artesanías. Ella dice que vende sus productos por Carapeguá y también tiene pedidos de Asunción. Sus vecinos dicen que es responsable y trabajadora, valores importantes para el progreso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, colorantes y demás, los cuales son esenciales para el tejido. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Señorita Zunilda, age 31, is single. She has one son who is young and depends on her. She lives with her mother in the city of Carapeguá.

Zunilda is an artisan who has been involved in weaving since she was very young. This gives her a good income. She learned the profession from her mother, who used to teach her since she has the same skill. She has been weaving for 20 years.

Zunilda says she has very good hands for handicrafts. She says that she sells her products in Carapeguá and also has orders from Asunción (the capital). Her neighbors say she is responsible and hardworking, important values for making progress.

She is applying for the loan in order to purchase thread, needles, dyes and additional materials that are essential for weaving. She is thankful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity it has given her.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, dyes, and other materials essential for weaving.

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en:
Yolly works hard to support her family. Yolly is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Yolly has been in this business for seven years now.

Yolly requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

In the future, Yolly would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Aida Estela

texts.es: Aida Estela, D. cuarenta y siete años D. edad, resiD. en zona urbana con rumbo Oriente sobre carretera a uno D. los principales sitios turísticos del país, su grupo familiar lo conforman su esposo que trabaja como agricultor y dos hijos: Ramon y Fernando, el primero trabaja y estudia colaborando a los gastos D. la familia, mientras el segundo es apoyado por su hermano y padres. Recientemente Aida tubo la lamentable perdida D. su padré, embargándola por meses D. luto, pero Aida en ningún momento a dejado D. perseverar, siempre ha ido adelante. Ella desD. hace muchos años posee una tienda donD. dispensa productos D. primera necesidad a clientes y personas que circulan sobre calle principal donD. se situa su negocio, la amabilidad, buenos precios y localización ha hecho D. su tienda que sea la mas surtida del lugar, en ella uno encuentra desD. una pequeña aguja hasta gas propano, tiene un poco D. todo y eso hace que su clientela la prefiera. Aida se ha dado cuenta que los precios D. los granos básicos van incrementando debido al clima lluvioso D. los últimos días y tiene la oportunidad D. comprarlos al por mayor ahorita aun menor precio, espera poder contar con el apoyo D. INTEGRAL para adquirir ganancias y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia
texts.en:
Aida Estela is 47 years old and lives in an urban area which is on the east-bound highway to one of the country's main tourist sites.  Her family consists of her husband, who is a farmer, and her two children: Ramon and Fernando.  Her eldest son works and studies, helping with the family expenses, whilst her youngest is supported by his brother and parents.  Sadly, Aida recently lost her father, which led to months of mourning.  However, she never stopped persevering and has kept going.  

For many years, Aida has owned a store where she sells basic household products to her customers and people who pass by on the main road where her business is located.  Her kindness, good prices and good location have maD. her store the best-stocked in the area.  In her store you can find everything from a small needle to propane gas.  She has a little of everything and this is why her customers prefer to shop with her.  Aida has realized that the price of basic grains is increasing as a result of the recent rainy weather and she has the opportunity to buy them wholesale right now at a lower price.  She hopes to be able to count on the support of INTEGRAL so that she can make profits and improve her whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as corn, beans, rice and sugar

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en:
Herminigildo is 37 years old and married. He has three children.

Herminigildo works hard to provide for his family. He runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Herminigildo has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the firewood retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Herminigildo aspires to save enough money to expand his business and send his children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en: Ma. Cristina works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Ma. Cristina requested a loan for 3,100 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season. She also wants to minimize her kerosene expenses. Ma. Cristina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada is 42 years old. She is married and has one child. Diosdada has a motorcycle that her husband uses to provide transportation services. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tires and oil for maintenance. Diosdada has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Diosdada hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tires and oil for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Leonor Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Leonor es cliente recurrente de la fundación, pues confía mucho en nosotros, el mismo vive en la ciudad de Luque, vive en su casa propia con su esposa.
Don Leonor cuenta con una despensa desde el año 1992, por lo que ya cuenta con buena antigüedad en su negocio, en la mismo se encargan de atender Don Leonor y su esposa. El Señor cuenta con mas de 20 créditos cancelados con la fundación.
Comenta que en todos estos años que lleva con su negocio se ha formado ya una buena clientela que siempre van a su negocio, por lo que le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos abasteciendo mas su local, por ello solicita el crédito, para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, panificados y demás con lo que podrá surtirse.
texts.en:
Señor Leonor is a regular client of the Fundación; he trusts us a lot. Leonor lives in Luque city in his own home with his wife.
Leonor has had a food shop since 1992. His business is well-established, and he and his wife run it. He has taken out and repaid over 20 loans from the Fundacion.
He tells us that he has built up a good customer base throughout the years, and they always choose his business. He would like to be able to stock his store more, so he is requesting a loan for the purchase of food to stock his business; drinks, baked goods and more.

loans.use: to buy edible goods: drinks, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Dal Chini

texts.en:
Dal Chini is 50 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 28, 22, and 12. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her store. In the future, Dal Chini plans to improve the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla works hard to support her family. Priscilla is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Priscilla is borrowing 1,800 PHP through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family. Priscilla is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 57 years old and married with a child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rene has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Rene has been in this business for 15 years.

Rene requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap and other groceries to sell.

In the future, Rene would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, soap and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 51 years old. She is married and has five children. Agnes has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Agnes has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Agnes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona is 38 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more livestock.

Elona has been raising livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Aapasara

texts.en:
Aapasara is 28 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged four.  In 2000, she established her cow-raising business.  She supports her family by working seven days per week and four hours per day. 

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Aapasara plans to lift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung, which is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and for methane production.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Miguel Armando

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 34 años de edad, está casado desde hace tiempo y vive en su propia casa situada en la ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor Miguel es comerciante desde hace tiempo, tiene un local de venta de prendas de vestir para niños en el circuito comercial de la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene mucha clientela y vende diariamente ya que concurren muchos turistas por esa zona. Gracias a esta actividad el siempre ha podido mantener su hogar, cubrir todos los gastos, y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se pudiera presentar.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas para niños, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y surtir su local con mas variedad. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Miguel is 34 years old.  He has been married for a while, and he lives in his own house in the city of Encarnación.

Miguel has been a salesman for some time.  He has a stall selling children's clothing in the commercial area of the city of Encarnación.  He has a large clientele, and he sells every day, since there are many tourists in this zone.  Thanks to this business, he has always been able to maintain his home, cover all his costs, and pay for any unexpected expenses that arise.

He is seeking this loan to buy children's clothing so as to provide his store with more selection. This loan will be a big help to him in his plans.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 36 years old. She is married with one child. Tessie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has run a variety store for almost four years now. She sells instant noodles, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to the people in her neighborhood. She usually earns about P2,000 each month.

She is now requesting a loan for additional capital to buy canned goods, soap, biscuits, and eggs to sell. This will surely improve her sales and boost her profits. She is asking for a loan of P10,000.

In the future, she wants to make her small store grow into a bigger one.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, biscuits, and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora is married with 10 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Dioscora sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase more sacks of coconut shell for the making of charcoal for retail. Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Dioscora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of coconut shell for the production of charcoal for retail

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Señor Alfredo tiene 27 años de edad, tiene un hijo, y vine acompañado de sus esposa. Cuenta con una Peluquería en la Ciudad de Villarrica, donde realiza todo tipo de cortes ya sea para damas, caballeros y niños, también realiza trabajos de manicura, pedicuro y depilaciones en general.
El Señor Alfredo primeramente estudio peluquería en la Ciudad de Buenos Aires (Argentina) ejerció ahí su profesión y unos meses después regreso al Paraguay y mediante su buena preparación logra mantener su cantidad de clientela. 
Acude a la  Fundación Paraguaya para acceder a una pequeña ayuda crediticia que destinara a la compra de un Terreno para poder construir ahí en un futuro un local propio para su peluquería.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 27.  He has one son and lives with his wife.  He has a hair salon in the city of Villarrica, where he does all kinds of haircuts for women, men, and children, as well as manicures, pedicures, and waxing.  Alfredo first studied hair styling in Buenos Aires (Argentina), where he worked for some months before returning to Paraguay.  Thanks to his good skills, he has maintained a steady clientele.  

He came to mircofinance partner Fundación Paraguaya to ask for a small loan, which he will use to buy land on which to build his own hair salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy land on which to build his own hair salon.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is married with four children. She is 40 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Beverly sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 13,000 PHP to purchase more clothes to sell. Beverly has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, Beverly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 36 years old. She is married with five children. Cristina has a sari-sari store (a variety retail shop) that sells rice, canned goods, soap, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional rice, canned goods, soap, and beverages. Cristina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to be sold per kilogram, along with canned goods, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo is 48 years old. He is married with four children. Arnulfo has a motorcycle that is used for transport. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials like tires and oil to use for maintenance. Arnulfo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arnulfo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for maintenance, like tires and oil

loans.name: Vicente Alcibiades

texts.es:
El señor Vicente tiene 46 años de edad, está casado con la sra Maria y tienen 4 hijos de 20, 18, 15 y 13 años respectivamente. Los dos mayores ya trabajan y los dos menores están todavía en el colegio.
Don Vicente  comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba  por su cuenta como Talabartero(trabajos realizados sobre Cueros) contaba con máquinas y también con personales, pero que luego hubo una época de escasez y dejó ese trabajo.
Actualmente  se dedica como comerciante en forma de macate (ambulante) ya que lleva todo tipos de productos  para la venta por el interior del país y por sobretodo en el Chaco, para ello alquila una camioneta donde una vez a la semana sale a vender a los pequeños comercios de la zona que visita, normalmente ya tiene su propia clientela formada.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra al por mayor de los productos que vende, como ser prendas de vestir, frazadas, pantalones, calzados y demás.
texts.en:
Vicente is 46, and married to María. They have four children, ages 20, 18, 15, and 13 respectively. The two eldest are already working, and the two youngest are still in school. Vicente tells us that previously he worked on his own account as a saddler (work done with leather). He used to have machines and also a workforce, but then he had a lean season, and left this line of work.

Currently he works as a travelling salesperson, as he carries all kinds of products to sell in the interior of the country and especially in the Chaco region. That's why he rents a small truck, and once a week goes out to sell to the small businesses of the area that he visits. He already has his own established list of customers. 

The loan he is applying for, is to buy at wholesale the products he sells, such as articles of clothing, blankets, pants, footwear, and other merchandise.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing, blankets, and other merchandise for later sale.

loans.name: Ranie

texts.en:
Ranie is 42 years old and single. She was involved in a sari-sari store business before, but now she opts to have a clothing business where she sells ready-to-wear items like jeans and shirts for both male and female. She has had this business for almost one year. She requests a loan for 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional variety of clothing for children and for adult wear.

Ranie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ranie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell, like ready-to-wear items such as jeans and shirts for both male and female.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase daily needs merchandise for her small kiosk.

loans.name: René Antonio

texts.es: René Antonio, reside en casa propia en la zona paracentral del país acompañado por su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa Patricia que es empleada y su hija de 12 años quien estudia sexto grado en la escuela. René posee en su misma casa de residencia un taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos desde hace mas de 10 años, tiene dos empleados  y es muy reconocido por clientes como que trabaja muy fino y a bajo costo, esto lo distingue.  René está siendo mayormente demandado con trabajo por sus cliente en estos últimos días y es por lo que decidió apoyarse con INTEGRAL para obtener el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de pinturas, macillas y reparar un compresor que recién se fundió. Espera contar cuanto antes con el financiamiento para satisfacer la demanda y no dejar ir los negocios y así además ofrecer a su familia todo lo que hasta ahora han necesitado y seguir soñando que su pequeña hija realice sus estudios superiores en la universidad
texts.en:
René Antonio lives in his own home in the 'zona paracentral' area of the country, together with his family: his wife Patricia, who is an employee, and his 12-year-old daughter who is in sixth grade.  René has a workshop in his home where he carries out bodywork on vehicles and paints them.  He has been doing this for more than 10 years.  He has two employees and is very well known by his customers because of the very fine work that he does at a low price.  This is what he is noted for.

René has a lot of demand from his customers these days and so he decided to approach INTEGRAL to obtain the money he needs to buy a larger quantity of paints and putties, and also repair a compressor which blew recently.  He hopes to receive this loan as soon as possible so that he can meet his demand and not neglect his business.  This will allow him to continue offering his family everything they need, as he has up to now, and continue dreaming that his young daughter will go on to study at university.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of paint and putties and to repair a compressor that recently blew

loans.name: Jimelita

texts.en:
Jimelita is 62 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Jimelita sells nutritious snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase flour for her snack sales.

Jimelita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to have a number of food stalls in the town.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Migual

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel tiene 48 años de edad, esta acompañado con la  Sra. Blanca de 38 años de edad, ellos llevan 15 años juntos y tienen la dicha de tener 3 hijos.
El Sr. Miguel es comerciante se dedica a la compra – venta de terneritos holandos y los vuelve a vender por la zona y alrededores, se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 10 años contando con una clientela totalmente formada. Tiene la aspiración de ir creciendo día a día su negocio con la ayuda de sus hijos y así poder brindarles una vida digna y anhela alguna vez dedicarse al tambo lechero y esta muy confiado de que podrá lograrlo.
El solicita este crédito para la compra de mas terneritos ya que fue ampliando su clientela y cuenta con mayor demanda con la venta de sus holandos.
  .-
texts.en:
Migual is 48, and lives with his partner Blanca who is 38. They have been together for 15 years and are fortunate to have three children. Migual buys Holando (Argentine Holstein) calves, that he then sells locally and in the surrounding area. He has been working at this for more than 10 years, and has a well-established list of customers. 

He has the ambition to grow his business little by little, day by day, with the help of his children, and in this way provide them with a decent life. Sometimes he yearns to have a dairy farm, and he is very confident that he will be able to succeed. 

He is applying for this loan to buy more calves, as he has been gradually expanding his clientele, and has greater demand for his Holando calves.

loans.use: To buy calves for later sale.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion 2 Oroquieta City. She is widowed and has no children.

Carlita has a restaurant business and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase ingredients for viand (food items) and beverages for her restaurant.

Carlita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for viand (food items) and beverages for her restaurant.

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal is 42 years old, widowed, and has two children, both of whom attend college. She lives with them in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayanhongor province,  Mongolia. 

Bayanjargal started her garment retailing business in 2003 by renting a counter in a market. She is well known for her fashionable goods and her excellent service. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to buy some warm clothes to sell. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "It has been difficult since my husband passed away however I never stepped back, I will rest when my kids are graduated and employed." 

Bayanjargal is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT, which she will use to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Philippines.

Thelma is a farmer growing vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She is requesting a loan for 2,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer of her vegetable plants. 

Thelma has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to grows more vegetable plants and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer of her vegetable plants.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 33 years old. She is married with one child.

Marjorie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

Marjorie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marjorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell like snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 47 years old. She is married with two children.

Mary Jean has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothes like t-shirts, blouses and pants. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional t-shirts, blouses and pants to sell.

Mary Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mary Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Argen

texts.en:
Argen is 22 years old. She is married and has two children.

Argen has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for almost three years. She requested a loan for 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Argen has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Argen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell like snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife makes traditional boots and his kids go to private school. He started his private taxi service in 2008 using his own car. Also, he with helps operate his wife's shoe-making business. They make shoes that are very stylish and in high quality. He is a hardworking, diligent man who says "I love to make shoes and we're trying to make different designs of shoes as well." He is requesting 500,000 Mongolia tughriks (MNT) to buy materials to make shoes.

loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 42 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with two children.

Nelfa has a sari-sari (variety) store business and earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 14,900  to purchase more product stock for her general store.

Nelfa has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more product stock for her general store.

loans.name: Felicitacion

texts.en: Felicitacion is a 47-year-old married woman with nine children. She and her husband, who is a fisherman, work together to support their family. Felicitacion sells her husband's catch at the market. Aside from fish, they also sell crabs. Felicitacion requested a loan to buy fishing nets and crab traps. She hopes for their business to grow more. She also plans to pay her children's tuition fees with her profit.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and crab traps.

loans.name: Vueon

texts.en:
Vueon is 30 years old, married, and has one child.  She is a pig feeder earning $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who also earns $5 per day. Every month she has to spend $50 on food and $20 on other expenses. 

Vueon is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to buy pigs and feed. She wants to increase her pig supply with the loan because she can earn a good income for her family selling pigs and use her knowledge in this area to increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Glenrose

texts.en:
Glenrose is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Glenrose has a sari-sari (general) store and has had this business for six years. She earns 20,000 PHP a month. 

Glenrose is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stock for her store.  She has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Srey Neang

texts.en:
Srey Neang is 28 years old, married, and two children, one of whom attends school. She is a garment factory worker earning $3.50 a day. Her husband provides taxi services and earns $5 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 for food, $5 for electricity, $10 for school fees, and $23 for other expenses. 

Srey Neang is requesting a loan for $600, which she will use to buy zinc and steel to repair the roof of her house. The loan helps her family to have a better house.

loans.use: to buy zinc and steel to repair her house

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 56 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for almost two years. 

Esperanza is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell in the store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with two children. She is 55 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosita sells silver and fancy jewelry to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to purchase additional jewelries to sell/retail.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional jewelry to sell/retail.

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 29 years old, is a palm sugar seller. Her husband is a construction worker and provides motor taxi services, earning $6 per day. They have two children, both of whom are studying. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $8 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses.

Yen requests a loan of $300 to buy cattle for farming and transporting firewood to make palm sugar. She wants to buy more palm product to make palm sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy cattle for farming.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam, D. cuarenta y cinco años D. edad, tiene su negocio al Occidente del país cerca a una D. las principales terminales D. buses D. la ciudad, su grupo familiar lo conforma su esposo quien es empleado, y tres hijos: Jenifer, José y Mauricio, al menos Jenifer con sólo 16 años ya trabaja y aporta a la economía D. éste hogar, los demás por ahora sólo estudian. Miriam mujer trabajadora y responsable desD. hace muchos años se vío en la necesidad D. vender mariscos para colaborarle a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar, todas las mañanas desD. las 5 am, compra a los pescadores su producto fresco y lo revenD. en mercado D. la localidad o incluso ambulantemente en colonias cercanas al mercado, es muy preferida por sus clientes por tener siempre producto D. primera y por ello últimamente su demanda ha incrementado en cuanto al camarón D. río y D. mar, langosta y pescado conocido como “boca colorada”, por ello y con experiencia crediticia ha tomado la mano D. INTEGRAL para poder contar con un crédito que le permita desarrollarse aún mas con su negocio y así también espera mejore la calidad D. vida D. su familia.-
texts.en:
Ana Miriam, 45, has her business in the west of the country near one of the city’s main bus terminals.  Her family unit consists of her husband who is employed and three children: Jenifer, José and Mauricio.  Jenifer, 16, works and contributes to the home’s economy; the others are students for now.

Miriam is a hardworking, responsible woman who many years ago found herself needing to sell seafood to help her husband support the household.  She goes out every morning at 5am to buy fresh product directly from the fishermen and then resells it in her local market or door to door in neighborhoods near the market.  She is preferred by her customers because she always has first quality product so demand has increased with respect to river and sea shrimp, lobster and a fish known as “boca colorada” [red snapper].  Because of this and with credit experience she has taken INTEGRAL’s hand to get a loan that will permit her to develop still more with her business as well as improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy river and sea shrimp, lobster and fish known as "boca colorada."

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is separated with one child. Jeanette is 32 years old and lives in Gala Ozamiz City, Philippines.

Jeanette sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000.

Jeanette has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jeanette hope to buy a service to use for her banana delivery.

loans.use: To purchase a fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Sles

texts.en:
Mrs. Sles is a used clothing seller. She rents a booth and sells her used clothing in front of a garment factory, where it is crowded. Her potential customers are garment factory workers. 

She has run a clothing sale business with her husband for many years, but her husband does not work in the same place with her. He usually sells used clothing in mobile places, especially in the provinces. Retail is the main source of the family’s income. Together, Mrs. Sles and her husband are able to earn around $9 USD each day to cover their daily needs. 

Mrs. Sles would like to ask for some funds from Kiva through HKL to buy additional clothing stock. She is now 36 years old and has two children, who are supported by her income and study in a local public school.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing stock.

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en: Phanny, 36 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $10 per day. She is a single mother with three children; two are studying and one more is only three years old. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fee, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy more grocery goods to sell. She wants to extend her grocery store to sell more kind of goods so that she can gain more customers and income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en: Banzragch is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger, which is a Mongolian yurt in Bayanhongor, a province of Mongolia. His wife works with him. His older child goes to school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. He started his garment retailing business in 1995. Also, he has run an animal hides trading business since 2001. The livestock hides trading business is the most profitable so far. He needs to expand his shop by building an extension due to the size of the raw materials. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says: "I have a vision that someday I can build a two story building to make the first floor a supermarket and to live on the second floor". He is requesting 3,650,000 MNT to purchase more hides.

loans.use: To purchase more hides.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana  is 63 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with one child.
Ana  has a lamination business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase wood to be used for lamination.
Ana has been a member of PMPC for more than one year.

loans.use: to purchase wood to be used for lamination.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 43 years old. She is married with three children.
Fe has a retail shop that sells canned goods, toothpaste, soap and other daily use products. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, toothpaste, soap, and other daily use products.
Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily use products such as toothpaste, soap, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To have capital to buy and sell scrap materials, empty bottles and plastics.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 48 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 
Florita's business is to buy and sell rice and corn and she earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to purchase 3 sacks of rice for her retail business.
Florita has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of rice for her retail business.

loans.name: Marilyn Group

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with three adult-aged children. Marilyn is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Marilyn is a farmer and specializes in corn production to earn a living. Marilyn has been doing this for 8 years. Marilyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her business. 
Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for 3 year. In the future, Marilyn hopes to make her business successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her business.

loans.name: Bulgamaa

texts.en: Bulgamaa is 42 years old and lives with her son in a ger, which is a Mongolian yurt, in the Mongolian province of Bayanhongor. Her son is a school student. Her husband passed away. Her husband started the grocery trading business in 2000. After her husband died in 2008, she continued the business. She buys goods from the wholesalers and retails them in the local market. Recently, she bought a small piece of land to live on. Because of this purchase, she is lacking money. She is a strong and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy goods from Ulaanbaatar at whole sale price to sell.

loans.use: To buy goods from Ulaanbaatar at whole sale price to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, con sesenta y dos años de edad, reside sobre zona industrial donde en su entorno se hallan fabricas, su grupo familiar lo conforman su esposa quien tiene negocio de tortillas también en el lugar colaborando a la economía de ésta familia; y dos hijas que estudian en la universidad y que además son empleadas y por lo menos cubren sus gastos personales con ello. Roberto cuenta desde hace muchos años con una tienda en su misma casa en la que provee a sus clientes de productos de primera necesidad, Roberto es muy bien referenciado por vecinos y clientes como responsable, honesto y trabajador y en los últimos cuatro meses ha experimentado un incremento en la demanda de sus productos dado que otro negocio cercano al suyo se ha trasladado de lugar y ello ha hecho que los clientes de las fabricas cercanas lo prefieran por contar con las cosas que necesitan como bebidas dulces, pan dulce, medicinas, sardinas, lácteos y embutidos que son los que se están terminando rápido y no quiere quedarse diciendo: ¡no tengo! , quiere satisfacer siempre a sus clientes y llevar a la vez el sustento diario a su familia.-
texts.en:
Roberto, 62, lives in an industrial neighborhood where there are factories.  His family unit consists of his wife who has a tortilla business there also contributing to family economy and two daughters who are going to the university but are also employed and able to cover their personal expenses at least.

For many years Roberto has had a home-based grocery store providing his customers with staple items.  Roberto is well referred to by his neighbors and customers as being responsible, honest and hardworking.  The last four months have seen a rise in demand for his products because a nearby store has moved away so customers from nearby factories prefer him because he stocks the things they need like soft-drinks, candy, sweet bread, medicine, sardines, dairy products and cured meats which sell out quickly and he doesn’t want to have to say “I don’t have any!”  He wants to always satisfy his customers as well as provide daily sustenance for his family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Hansel

texts.en:
Hansel is a 21-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in fishing for 5 years. Hansel is asking for a loan to purchase fishing nets and gasoline for the boat. This will help him continue earning from his business.

Hansel works hard to support his family of a wife and two children. He does his best to be a good husband and father. Hansel hopes his business will grow and be stable.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and gasoline for the boat.

loans.name: Chansom

texts.en: Chansom, 27 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $6 per day. Her husband works for the government and earns $3 per day. They have three children; all are studying. Every month, she has to spend $77 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fee, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $300 to add to her money to buy a small car for her husband to travel to work and for other uses for the family. She plans to extend her grocery store to sell more kinds of products.

loans.use: To buy a small car for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years. She is married with eight children. 
Delia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, other food products, and daily use products.  She has had this business for three years.  She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional daily use products, food, and canned goods.
Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily use products, food, and canned goods to be sold for retail.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim who is 43 years old, is a farmer and sells palm sugar which earns her $2 per day.  Her husband is a construction worker and earns $2 per day also.  They have four children.  One is studying and the other three are working in a factory.  Each earns $2 per day.  Every month she has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on school fees.  She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy construction material to repair her house.  She also plans to buy a plot of land to do more farming and she will also support her daughter in opening a tailoring shop at home.

loans.use: To buy construction material to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making rice cakes and cupcakes to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to supply the needs of her family. She is 42 years old, widowed, and has been blessed with five children. Since her husband died, she stands as the father and mother to her children. According to her, being a single parent is quite difficult, but through the guidance of our Almighty God, she still stands to provide her family with all their needs. 

Corazon has run her hog raising business for three years and she is grateful because her family members are supportive of this kind of business. She would like to maintain her business so that she can send her family into higher levels of education.

Corazon is asking for a loan P7,000 to be use in buying piglets and feed for the daily maintenance of her raised hogs. She hopes that she can obtain the loan amount she requested to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy one piglet and also feed for daily maintenance of her hog raising business.

loans.name: Hajidsuren

texts.en: Hajidsuren is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in ger, a mongolian yurt, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia.
