Her husband runs a coal retailing business and a part time private taxi service.  Her kids go to school.  She started her business in 2000 running a grocery shop in a market. In 2004 she started her own small cafe as well.  Her cafe's workplace needs some new equipments to run faster.  Hajidsuren is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "I try to work with my every possible resource."  She is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy new equipment and tires for her husband's car.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and tires.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es: José Alfredo vive con sus dos hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cercana a la localidad donde residen. El posee una tienda en su hogar donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, pan, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues los productos que comercia son de muy buena calidad y los vende a precios accesibles,  además el servicio es inigualable siempre José y sus hijos que le ayudan en el negocio reciben a las personas con una sonrisa en el rostro; él es un hombre emprendedor muy dedicado a su trabajo siempre preparado para recibir nuevas oportunidades, él piensa que para triunfar en la vida hay que subir escalón por escalón hasta llegar arriba y es lo que está intentado lograr es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, pastas, golosinas, bebidas etc. José Alfredo tiene confianza que de esta forma lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
José Alfredo lives with his two children who are going to a local school near their house.  He has a home-based grocery store where he sells staple items like rice, beans, bread and milk among others.  Lately he has acquired many customers because the products he sells are very high quality and he sells them at affordable prices.  Besides, service in unequalled.  José and his children who help him in the store always welcome their customers with a smile on their face.  

He is an enterprising man who is very dedicated to his work, always prepared to receive new opportunities.  He thinks that in order to be successful in life one must rise step by step to reach the top and this is what he’s trying to accomplish.  This is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy staple items like instant products, pasta, snacks, soft-drinks, etc.  José Alfredo is confident that he will be able to provide his home with economic security and a better quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth de cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive con su hijo. Ella posee un comedor y pupuseria es muy conocida en la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues los platillos que prepara en su negocio son exquisitos, cocina de todo tipo de comidas sopas, carnes con arroz, ensaladas, pupusas entre otros y todo lo vende a precios accesibles además el lugar es muy higiénico; Elizabeth es una mujer amante de la cocina por eso le encanta su trabajo, para ella el secreto del éxito está en el amor que le pones a tu labor, quiere alcanzar varias metas y una de ellas es hacer crecer el negocio, por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar chicharrón, queso, carnes, granos básicos, verduras, bebidas entre otros. Elizabeth tiene fe que con su duro trabajo lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elizabeth, 58, lives with her son.  She has an eatery and pupusa shop that’s very well known in her community.  She’s acquired quite a few customers because the dishes she prepares at her business are exquisite.  She cooks all sorts of dishes: soups, meats with rice, salads and pupusas, among others.  She sells everything at affordable prices and her place is very hygienic.  Elizabeth loves cooking so she thoroughly enjoys her work.  For her, the secret of success is in the love one puts into work.  She wants to reach several goals.  One of them is to make the business grow so she’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fried pork, cheese, meats, basic grains, vegetables and soft-drinks, among others.  Elizabeth has faith that with hard work she will accomplish providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, meats, basic grains, beverages and vegetables.

loans.name: Martha Grissel

texts.es: Martha Grissel  D. treinta y nueve años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida. Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad últimamente se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos D. muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles; Martha es una mujer muy activa con muchas ganas D. salir adelante, trabajando duro para lograrlo, para ella el secreto D. una vida exitosa se encuentra en la perseverancia y el amor que se le dedica a la labor que se realiza, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos instantáneos, golosinas, pan, aceites, pastas etc. Martha Grissel tiene la esperanza que D. esta forma lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Martha Grissel, 39, lives with her life companion.  She has a store where she sells basic staples.  Lately her customers have increased because she’s always stocked with what they need: good quality items at really accessible prices.  Martha is a very active woman with a strong drive to get ahead working hard to accomplish it.  For her, the secret of a successful life lies in perseverance and the love one puts into whatever work one does.  Because of this she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy instant products, snacks, bread, oil, pasta, etc.  Martha Grissel hopes to proviD. her family with a better quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Blanca Delmi

texts.es: Blanca Delmi vive con sus hijos en una localidad muy concurrida D. personas, aquí posee una tienda donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad granos básicos, pan, jabón entre otros, es muy conocida en el lugar, pues Blanca siempre tiene lo que sus clientes necesitan con productos D. calidad a precios accesibles, además les da la atención que se merecen; Blanca Delmi es una mujer emprendedora con ganas D. salir adelante siempre está dispuesta a trabajar duro para lograr sus objetivos, para ella nunca se sabe a ciencia cierta lo que se pueD. lograr si no se intenta y es por eso que Blanca está intentando hacer crecer su negocio es así como se decidió a  solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos para surtir la tienda como granos básicos, golosinas, pan, productos instantáneos, bebidas, jabones  etc. Blanca Delmi tiene la confianza que D. esta forma lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Blanca Delmi lives with her children in a busy part of town, where she has a grocery store, selling basic goods such as flour and rice, bread, soap and other things. Her store is well known locally because Blanca always has what her customers need, and selling quality goods at affordable prices means the store gets the attention it deserves. Blanca Delmi is an enterprising woman who is keen to succeed. She is not afraid of hard work to reach her goals. For Blanca, there is no mystery to it: you cannot succeed if you don't try, which is why she intends to expand her business and decided to seek a loan from INTEGRAL. The loan will allow her to buy products to stock the store, such as flour and rice, candies, bread, instant meals, drinks, soap, etc. Blanca Delmi is confident that doing so will help her succeed and give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy staples such as flour and rice, candies, bread, instant meals, drinks, soap

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es: Ana Maribel D. D. cincuenta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida. Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad, su negocio es muy famoso en la localidad donD. resiD., pues siempre tienen lo que el cliente necesita, con productos D. excelente calidad y a precios accesibles ; Ana Maribel es una mujer muy activa siempre esta trabajando y su tienda la abre desD. muy temprano; para ella el secreto del éxito, es perseverar en el empeño, para alcanzar las metas es por eso que Ana siempre está buscando la forma D. mejorar en su negocio, lo quiere hacer crecer es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, pan, granos básicos, producto instantáneo etc. Ana Maribel tiene esperanza que D. esta forma lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Ana Maribel is fifty-five years old and lives with her partner, though they are not married. She has a store where she sells every day groceries, and her business is well known locally because she always has what her customers are looking for and she sells top-quality goods at affordable prices. Ana Maribel is a very active woman, always working. Her store opens very early in the morning. For her, the secret of success is persevering with what you start until you reach your goal, For this reason Ana Maribel is always looking for ways to improve her business. In order to grow her business, she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy candies, bread, flour, rice, instant meals, etc. Ana Maribel hopes this will help her succeed in giving her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy candies, bread, instant meals, and staples like rice and flour.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Socorro vive con su hijo el cual aun asiste a la escuela, residen en una zona muy concurrida D. personas, donD. ella posee una tortillería y una pequeña tienda con la que sostiene su hogar, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela últimamente pues Socorro venD. las tortillas más ricas del lugar, además los productos que ofrece en su tienda son D. muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios;  Socorro es toda una trabajadora llena D. metas por alcanzar, para ella el entusiasmo es un elemento vital para el éxito es por eso que con mucho ánimo le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, maíz por mayor entre otros. Socorro tiene fe que D. esta forma con su trabajo duro lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Socorro lives with her son, who goes to school. They live in a very busy part of town, where she has a tortillería (a place where she makes and sells tortillas) and a small grocery store. Socorro and her son live on the money she makes from these enterprises. She has built up a great customer base of late, because she makes the best tortillas around, and the goods she sells in the store are good quality at excellent prices. Socorro is a hard worker through and through, always striving for the next goal. For her, enthusiasm is the vital ingredient for success, and so it is with great enthusiasm that she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL. The loan will enable her to buy flour and rice, candies, bread, instant meals, among other things, and corn, which she buys in bulk. Socorro has faith that with her hard work she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy staples such as flour and rice, as well as candies, bread, instant meals, and corn.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel D. cincuenta y dos años D. edad vive con sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee  una tortillería con la que sostiene su hogar, es famosa en el lugar, la gente la visita porque venD. las tortillas más ricas D. la zona y despacha a sus clientes muy rápido además D. los buenos precios; María Isabel es una mujer muy activa siempre está adelante D. la competencia trabajando duro para hacer crecer el negocio; para ella el éxito en la vida consiste en seguir siempre adelante es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo y satisfacer a su clientela. María Isabel tiene la esperanza que así lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: María Isabel is fifty-two years old and lives with her children in their own house. She has a tortillería (a place where she makes and sells tortillas), and the money it brings in is what sustains the household. People come to her because she sells the best tortillas around, and because she serves her customers quickly and charges good prices. María Isabel is a very active woman, always staying ahead of the competition and working hard to grow her business. For her, success in life means always moving forward. For this reason, she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan which will enable her to buy corn, in bulk, so that she can go on producing tortillas and keeping her customers happy. María Isabel hopes that in this way she will build a secure economic foundation for her household.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk

loans.name: Jreb

texts.en: Jreb is 41 years old and is a cake seller earning $5 per day.  She is a single mother with two children, a five and one year old.  Every month she has to spend $60 on food, $8 on electricity, and $20 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy materials to make cakes to sell.  She doesn’t wants to change her career because she earns a good income from this.  Jreb says she will make more cakes when she has more customers.

loans.use: To buy baking supplies for making cakes to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su nieto en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de fruta y un comedor que atiende los domingos, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la fruta que vende es fresca y de muy buena calidad, además en su comedor la gente la prefiere porque prepara ricos platos de comida como sopas y carne asada en un lugar muy higiénico, todo lo que comercia lo vende a precios accesibles; Juana es una mujer muy enérgica le gusta levantarse desde muy temprano a empezar su trabajo, para ella la clave del éxito depende sólo de lo que podamos hacer de la mejor manera posible y atender su negocio es lo que mejor realiza es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar fruta por mayor, y materia prima para sus comidas como carnes, verduras, condimentos, granos básicos entre otros. Juana tiene fe que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana is fifty-seven years old and lives with her partner and their grandson, in thier own house. She has a fruit stall, as well as a small diner which she opens on Sundays. She has built up a good customer base because the fruit she sells is fresh and very good quality. People also like her diner because she cooks delicious dishes such as soups and grilled meat, in a very hygenic kitchen. Everything she sells, she sells at affordable prices. Juana is a woman who is full of energy and who likes to get up early for her work. For her, the key to success is simply doing what we do to the best of our ability, and looking after her business is what she does best. For this reason she has come to INTEGRAL seeking a loan to buy fruit in wholesale quantities, and ingredients for her dishes, such as meat, vegetables, condiments, and staples such as flour and rice. Juana has faith that in this way she will succeed in improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit, meat, vegetables, condiments, and staples such as flour and rice.

loans.name: María Efigenia

texts.es: María Efigenia de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive con su padre e hijo en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, es muy conocida en la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues vende productos de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio que ofrece María es único; Ella es una mujer entregada a su trabajo para ella cualquier cosa que valga la pena tener, merece que se trabaje por ella, es por eso que María trabaja duro por su negocio y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, condimentos, jabones etc. María Efigenia tiene esperanza que su duro trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Efigenia, 51 years old, lives with her father and son in her own house.  She owns a store where she sells basic consumption items.  She is well known in the area and has attracted many customers by selling good quality products at reasonable prices and providing service beyond comparison.  She is a person that is very dedicated to her work.  For her, anything that is worth having is worth working for, and that is why she works so hard in her business.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, instant products, condiments, soaps, etc.. Maria Efigenia hopes that her hard work will allow her to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sweets, bread, instant products, condiments, soaps, etc

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old and married. 

Nancy has a shop that sells blankets, pillow cases, bed sheets, and bath towels. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy additional blankets, bed sheets, bath towels, and pillow cases.

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional blankets, bed sheets, carpets, pillow cases, and bath towels.

loans.name: Tania De Los Andes

texts.es: Tania de los ángeles de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una carpintería es muy conocida en el lugar y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, realiza muebles como sillas, mesas, escritorios entre otros, todo al gusto del cliente y los vende a  precios muy accesibles; Tania es una mujer muy trabajadora y tiene un don inigualable, para ella el secreto de la felicidad no es hacer siempre lo que se quiere, sino en querer siempre lo que se hace y Tania ama su trabajo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera por mayor, pegamento, clavos, entre otros. Tania de los Ángeles tiene fe que con su esfuerzo lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Tania de Los Angeles, 39 years old, lives with her children in her own home.  She owns a carpentry shop and is very well known in the area.  She has attracted many customers because her work is of very good quality.  She makes furniture, such as chairs, tables, desks and others, all made to order and sold at very reasonable prices.  Tania is a very hard working woman with a unique gift.  For her the secret to happiness is not to always do what she wants but to always want to do what she has to do.  Tania loves her work.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy wood, glue, nails and other supplies. Tania de Los Angeles has faith that her hard work will allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wood, glue and nails.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela de sesenta y dos años de edad vive con sus hijos y nietos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues a pesar de ser una excelente vendedora lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio que les ofrece Graciela es inigualable siempre los recibe con una sonrisa en el rostro; es una mujer amante del trabajo, para ella no existe en el mundo nada más poderoso que una mujer trabajando por un objetivo, es por eso que ella es dedicada a su negocio y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos etc. Graciela tiene la confianza que así lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Graciela, 62 years of age, lives with her children and nephews in her own home.  She own a business selling beauty products such as perfumes, creams and others.  She has lately obtained many customers because in addition to being a good sales person, the quality of her products is very good and the prices are more than reasonable.  Also, the service that Graciela offers is unequalled, she always greets her customers with a smile.  She is a woman that loves to work.  For her there does not exist anything more powerful than a woman working towards a goal, this is why she is so dedicated to her business.  She is requesting a loan fro INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc..  Graciela has confidence that thru her work she will be able to give her family financial security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Punlork

texts.en:
Punlork, 30 years old, is a driver for a tourist company. He earns $10 per day. His wife is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. They have a four year old child. 

Every month Punlork has to spend $100 on food, $10 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy clothes for his wife to sell in the market.  When he has enough money, he wants to buy a small shop in the market for his wife to sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for his wife to sell in the market.

loans.name: Battsengel

texts.en:
Battsengel is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife runs his commodity business and his two children go to school.
 
He started his dairy in 1999 and since 2007 started to sell clothes. Also, he runs a taxi business using his own car, which he upgraded recently. Now he wants to settle down by running a more convenient business. 

He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I have been going to rural areas to do my business for a while now. It is time for me to settle down." He is planning to construct a building for his commodity shop. He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to build a clothes shop and to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to build a clothes shop and to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Samun

texts.en:
Samun, 51 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom are studying. But two are studying and working at the same time, earning $14 per day in all.
 
Every month Samun has to spend $66 on food, $10 on electricity, and $35 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $800 for school fees, $400 each for two of her children, to pay for their studies at the university. 

She doesn’t have any plan for a new career because she is getting old and she doesn’t have any knowledge to do anything else.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Sokarn

texts.en:
Sokarn, 48 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a worker who earns $3 per day. They have four children. Two are working, each earning $3 per day, and the other two stay home. Every month, she has to spend $82 on food and $10 on other expenses.
 
Sokarn would like to request a loan of $600 to buy more grocery goods to sell in her grocery store. She wants to extend her grocery shop to sell more kinds of groceries so that she can get more customers and income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her house and use the remaining capital for buying more fish.

loans.name: Bathuleg

texts.en:
Bathuleg is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband works at the government agency and her kids go to school. 

Bathuleg started her pharmacy business in 2006. Her pharmacy is known as the best quality in the neighborhood. She just finished her pharmacy extension. Now she is requesting 2,000,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT) to buy pharmaceuticals. She is a hard-working, diligent woman who says"I have a vision that someday I would turn my pharmacy to first class."

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals.

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en:
Lhamsuren is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and her kids go to private school. She started her grocery retail business in 2007 when she moved to the province's capital. 

Now that province's living condition is increasing, Lhamsuren is planning on broaden the range of products that she sells. She is a hardworking woman who says "Our province's living condition is increasing. Therefore I have to expand my business in order to support my family." She is requesting 600,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT) to purchase a range of products from Ulaanbaatar to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a range of products from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Исроил проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 54 года. Он вдовец. У него 10 детей. Его сыновья работают, дочки живут отдельно, а двое младших его детей учатся в средней школе. Сам он занимается изготовлением деревянных окон и дверей. В этой области он 25 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сырья, чтобы производит новые виды окон и дверей для продажи.
texts.en: Isroil lives in the region of Dangara. He is 54 years old. He is a widower and has ten children. His sons work, his daughters live separately and two younger children go to school. He makes wooden doors and windows. He has been in this business for 25 years. Isroil is taking out the loan to buy raw materials to make new kinds of windows and doors for sale.

loans.use: to buy slates and CPD.

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en: Munhbat is 27 years old and lives with his parents and brother in a ger (a mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor, Mongolia. His father is a taxi driver, his mother runs a coal retail business and his brother is a college student. Munhbat started his cell phone repair and retail business in 2009 and his business has been sustainable ever since. He is known as the 'gold-handed kid' in the neighborhood, a nickname he was given for being an excellent repairman. Munhbat has a bright vision to open another branch of his workshop. He is an excellent, skilled and hardworking man, but as he says, "Now that cell phone's are more advanced, my tools and kits are too old to repair". Munhbat is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy some tools and cell phone parts.

loans.use: to buy some tools and cell phone parts.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en: Nyamsuren is 52 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger (a mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her daughter is a college student. Since 2001, Nyamsuren has had a contract with the public transportation service; she uses her own van. Now that the van is getting old, it needs some serious maintenance. She is a strong and hardworking woman. Nyamsuren says, "Now that my daughter joined a college, I need to work hard in order to support her". She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts to repair her van.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell in the market.

loans.name: Saidamoh

texts.ru: Саидамох занимается шитьем и вышивкой. Она шьет национальные платья, чакан. Ей 34 года. Этим видом деятельности она занимается четыре года. Саидамох замужем. У них шестеро детей. Ее муж носильщик. Саидамох берет кредит для приобретения однотонных тканей и цветных специальных ниток для вышивания.
texts.en: Saidamoh does sewing and embroidery. She sews national Tajik dresses called chakan. She is 34 years old. She has been in this business for four years. Saidamoh is married and has six children. Her husband is a porter. Saidamoh is taking out the loan to buy monochrome fabrics and special color threads for embroidery.

loans.use: to purchase monochrome fabrics and color threads.

loans.name: Munhotgon

texts.en: Munhotgon is 30 years old and lives with her two sisters, two brothers and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Govisumber, Mongolia. One of her sisters is disabled, her two brothers are herders, her other sister stays at home and watches over Munhotgon's daughter and her elder daughter is a school student. She is single and the only provider for the family. Munhotgon sells food and drinks in the train station for a living. She lacks kitchen appliances and raw materials. She is requesting 450,000 MNT to buy kitchen appliances and meat to make food.

loans.use: to buy kitchen appliances and meat.

loans.name: Oktobrisuren

texts.en: Oktobrisuren is 51 years old and lives with her four kids and granddaughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Govi-sumber province of Mongolia. Her eldest son goes to college and the rest are school students. She sells foods and drinks outdoors since 1990. Sometimes her kids help with her business. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says "I do everything I can to support my kids." She requests 300,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT) to buy food products for her business.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Mirzosaid

texts.ru: Мирзосаид проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он имеет среднее образование. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Мирзосаид разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Mirzosaid lives in the region of Khuroson. He is 34 years old, he is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. He has secondary education. He makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. Mirzosaid breeds the cattle at home. He is taking out the loan to buy several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle.

loans.name: Ranel

texts.en: Ranel is 31 years old. He is married and has 2 children.  Ranel has a unit of motorela (a motorcycle with a 2-wheeled 4-6 passenger cabin attached to the back) used to load passengers and transport them within the village. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 for the maintenance of the motorela and to buy some needed parts for it. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ranel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his motorela.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional sacks of grains to sell and to pay her hired help

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 36 years old. She is married and has three children. 

Chanda has a shop that buys and sells and scrap items, empty bottles, and recyclable plastics. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) as additional capital for buying and selling of  scrap materials like  irons, empty bottles and recyclable plastics. 

Chanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Chanda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: Used as capital for buying and selling  scrap materials like irons, empty bottles and plastics

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 47 years old and sells food in his small eatery in his community. It has been three years since he started this business and it was a great help to improve his poor lifestyle. His business is a source of his income when he got sick. He was thankful that he built his eatery business through the help of Alalay Sa kaunlaran Inc., because it serves as his source of expenses in times of emergencies. 

Richard is being patient to cook every day in order to earn a higher income. He is saving for emergencies as well as for the education of his nephew that he adopted, due to inability of his parents to send him in school. 

As of now, he is asking for a loan of 18,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy pancit (noodles), soy sauce, calamansi (a citrus fruit), bihon (rice vermicelli) and soft drinks as additional raw ingredients to sell. He hopes through these goods he can make a higher income.

loans.use: to buy pancit, soy sauce, calamansi, bihon and soft drinks as additional raw ingredients to sell

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Толибчон проживает в районе Бохтар. Он женат. Ему 36 лет. Его жена домохозяйка. У них двое детей. Он занимается торговлей на рынке. Толибчон продает женскую одежду. В этой области он восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения теплых женских свитеров и покупки семян. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Tolibjon lives in the Bohtar region. He is married. He is 36 years old. His wife is a homemaker. They have two children. He sells on the market. Tolibjon sells women's clothing and has been in this business for eight years. He is taking out the loan to buy warm women's sweaters and buy seeds. He wants to increase the variety of his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy warm women's sweaters and buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two more hogs and feed

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 38 years old. She is a single mother with two children.

Teresita had a shop that sells packed spices before, but now she opts to have a video karaoke business of which she owns a share. She has had this business for almost a year. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to pay for the maintenance of the video karaoke machine and to expand her shop to a bigger one.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her videoke machine.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old. She is married with four children.

Myrna buys ready-to-wear clothes like blouses and t-shirts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional clothes for selling.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Myra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes like blouses and t-shirts for selling.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a widowed woman with three children who have completed school. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water and electricity bills. 

She has operated a meat goat selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goats to the market place. She dreams of being able to hire employees to help her with the running of her business.
	
With this loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it lends loans at a low interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 40 years old. She is separated from her husband but she has three children who live with her.

Alma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.en:
Vanesa is 31 years old, married and has four children who attend school. Vanesa owns a computer shop in the village where her family lives. She established her business five years ago. She offers printing and encoding services especially for students. She usually earns a daily profit of 300 PHP, which is just enough to cover the family's daily expenses for meals and allowances. 

Vanesa is requesting for a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy tarpaulins, colored papers and inks to use in her printing business. The loan will enable Vanesa to improve the services rendered to her customers.  In the future, she would like to make her family financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase tarpaulins, colored papers, and inks.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old.  She is married and has 2 children. Virginia has a shop that sells coco vinegar and coconut wine. She has had this business for 4 years.  

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy  additional coconut wine and vinegar to sell in the market. Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Virginia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut wine to sell in the market

loans.name: Taman Sari Group

texts.en:
The Taman S. group is located in Pemuteran village, Singaraja, North Bali. Most of the inhabitants work as farmers. They are facing the dry season  today, requiring them to find a side business to increase their income. The selected business is raising pigs, because in addition to getting venture capital loans, they also received training on how to raise pigs from MUK.

Taman S. is a group with 10 members with the leader, Luh Eka. Luh Eka, 34, is married with two children. Both children are still in primary school. Her husband works as a farmer. With this loan she hopes she will be able to help her husband to improve the family economy. She plans to use the loan to buy three piglets and the rest to buy feed. With this business she also hopes to save for the education of her two children.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and, with any remainder, to buy feed.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman.

Julita sells fish for a living. She sells his husband's catch and also buys fish from other fishermen. Julita does her best to help provide for her family. She has requested a loan to purchase fish traps, an ice box, and other materials. Julita hopes to have a successful business. She also hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fish traps, ice box, and other materials.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.ru: Азамат проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает мужскую одежду. Его жена помогает ему в торговле. Азамат в этой области шесть лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения зимней мужской одежды.
texts.en: Azamat lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 35 years old, married and has three children. He sells on the market. He has a vendor location where he sells mens clothing. His wife is helping him with the sales. Azamat has been in this business for six years. He is taking out the loan to buy mens winter clothing.

loans.use: to buy winter mens clothing.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman with three school-going children. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. Gladys has operated a cafe for the past three years; in addition she also practices farming. Her potential clients are her neighbors and the local company workers. The major challenge she faces is competition from other cafe operators. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her cafe.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma  is 43 years old.  She is a single mother with 4 children.  Gemma is now engaged in making and selling charcoal from coconut husks.  She has had this business for almost a year. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay for the laborer who made the charcoal. Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for the labor in making charcoal from coconut husks

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children.  Sally has a shop that sells used spare parts, like wheels or tires. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional used wheels and tires.  Sally has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Sally hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional used spare parts, like wheels or tires

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a 54-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been making clay pots for 10 years. Each month, Adelaida earns 8000 PHP with her business. She requested this loan to buy materials for pottery making. She also plans to pay her children's school fees. Adelaida hopes for her business to be stable. She also desires to see her children finish college and be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to buy materials for pottery making and pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn  is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a shop that sells items such as candies, snacks, and juices. She has had this business for six years. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Jocelyn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell such as candies, snacks, and juices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
The Sari Mertha group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Pejarakan, North Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of Rp.15,000,000, and each member will receive Rp.1,500,000.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement the family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising.  This is their second  loan with MUK.

Ni Luh is the head of the group. After her first loan, now she will use this loan to buy four more piglets. Ni Luh would like to help support her family with her pig raising business.   She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as meat.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to renovate her house

loans.use: To buy four more piglets.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 51 years old, widowed, and has one child.  She buys embutido (meat loaf), which is ready to sell. She has had this business for three years. 

Rosita is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy embutido. Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase food such as embutido.

loans.name: Jhona Liza

texts.en:
Jhona is 28 years old, single, and has one child. Jhona  has a shop that sells a variety of personal products such as body spray, nail polish,  and other cosmetics. She has had this business for more than two years. 

Jhona is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more of these products to sell in her shop.  Jhona has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as perfume, nail polish, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng is 50 years old with eight children. Her youngest child is still in school. She has been a tailor for 10 years. She also does rice farming. This is her first loan with VisionFund. With this loan, she hopes to increase her daily income from tailoring work, to increase her crop yield, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a power machine for her tailoring work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Азамчон житель района Бохтар. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он живет вместе с родителями. Азвмчон три года года как занимается торговлей. У него имеется собственная торговая точка, где он продает сувениры, искусственные корзинки цветов, часы и подарочные наборы. Он берет кредит для покупки комплекта хрустальной посуды и сувениров. В дальнейшем он хочет за счет полученной прибыли приобрести новую торговую точку.
texts.en: Azamjon lives in the Bohtar region. He is 33 years old, married and has one child. He lives together with his parents. Azamjon has been in the retail business for three years. He has his own vendor space where he sells souvenirs, imitation flowers pots, clocks and gift sets. He is taking out the loan to buy crystal dishware sets and souvenirs. In the future he wants to get another vendor location using the profit he will receive.

loans.use: to buy crystal dishware sets and souvenirs.

loans.name: Reme Group

texts.fr:
Marie Rose est une commerçante âgée de 43ans qui habite  la localité de Gitongo de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de manioc sec depuis 25 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Elle est mariée  a Michel qui est lui aussi vendeur de bananes et ont ensemble 8  enfants qui étudient.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 160,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de manioc sec à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« REME»
texts.en:
Marie Rose is a 43-year old trader who lives in the town of Gitongo in the Gitega province, which lies in the centre of the country. She has been trading in dry cassava for the past 25 years and is also a farmer. She went to school up until the 5th grade of primary school. She is married to Michel, who sells bananas, and they have eight children who are all studying.

The Kiva loan of 160,000 burundi francs which she will be granted will allow her to increase her capital so that she can buy large quantities of dry cassava and resell it at a large profit.

Marie Rose is a member of the Reme community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy large quantities of dry cassava for resale and to make significant profits

loans.name: Honoria

texts.en: Honoria lives near the public market in her town of Centro Southeast, Solana. About 10 years ago, she took advantage of an opportunity to open a store where she sells food and products people use every day such as soap and shampoo. She now earns an income of PHP 3,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, milk, coffee, instant noodles and canned goods to sell in her store. This will allow her to expand her business and increase her sales. Honoria is 56 years old, married and has two grown children. Her goal for the future is to increase her profits and save money that she can use to meet future expenses.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a married woman with two school-going children. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Kabibi has operated a mobile phone accessory shop for the past three years; her potential clients are local area residents. She dreams of establishing another shop in the future

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase more mobile phone spare parts and accessories for her shop. She decided to join Yehu because it offers loans to small entrepreneurs which help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phone spare parts and accessories for her shop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 45 years old. She is married with 2 children. Lilia  has a stall where she sells her steamed rice cakes, coconut wine and vinegar. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy an additional steamer, ingredients for rice cakes, as well as coconut wine for additional income.

Lilia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lilia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell and ingredients for making rice cakes

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is 27 years old. She is married and has a child. 

Gemalyn has a retail shop that sells coconuts and bananas. She also cooks and sells native delicacies such as steamed rice cake, coffee cake and other food snacks. She has had this business for over 5 years. 

She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy additional coconuts and bananas and to purchase additional ingredients to be used in cooking native delicacies such as steamed rice cake, coffee cake and other food snacks to sell.

Gemalyn joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and bananas and ingredients to be used in making native delicacies such as steamed rice, coffee cake, and other food snacks to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is married with one child. Perla is 58 years old and lives in Bañadero.

To earn a living, Perla sells dried fish. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has been requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. Perla has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her living situation.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом проживает в районе Яван. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. У них один ребенок. Абдусалом занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdusalom lives in the Yavan region. He is married. His wife is a homemaker. They have one child. Abdusalom breeds large horned cattle at home. He has been in this business for two years. He is taking out the loan to buy more large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 39 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

Evangeline is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a widow living in Sumalig Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. Lea is 33 years old and she has eight kids, all of whom live with her.

Lea operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been in this business for more than five years. Each month she earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She is doing this kind of business because it is in very high demand in her village. She requests a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy supplementary goods to sell in her sari-sari store. Lea is doing this to support her eight kids, especially in their studies.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Eusebia has a retail store which sells green bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more green bananas and coconuts.

Eusebia joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and green bananas to sell

loans.name: Sumber Usaha Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Usaha group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Pejarakan, North Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of Rp.15,000,000 and each member will receive Rp.1,500,000.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising. This is their second  loan with MUK.

Ni Luh is the head of the group. She will purchase one sow for pig breeding.  She hopes that the sow will have many piglets, which she will then be able to raise and sell.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to save for her future life.

loans.use: To purchase one sow

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 31 years old and married with 4 children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, detergents and other miscellaneous items.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling used clothing.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 46 years old. She is married and has five children. Gloria has a stall in the market that sells fruit, spices, and vegetables. She has had this business for 24 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional fruits and vegetable to sell in the market. Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetable to sell in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crabs, shrimp, fish, chicken, and pork meat to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is married with 5 children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Alma is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 18 years. She requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more feed. Alma has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy computers and scanners

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and married with two children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Jennifer has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for ten years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Jennifer aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 41 years old. She is married and has 2 children.  Alicia manufactures bamboo furniture. She has had this business for 9 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy bamboo, varnish and nails. Alicia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Alicia hopes to improve her business and to have a furniture shop.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like bamboo, varnish & nails

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is 61 years old and married. She lives in Migcanaway Tangub City. Alejandra operates a sari-sari store to earn a living and to sustain her own needs, and she has been in this business for 15 years. Each month she can earn PHP 7,000 from her sari-sari store. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy supplementary goods to sell. Alejandra has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future she hopes that her sari-sari store will expand.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ma.chuchi

texts.en:
As a married mother of 6 children, Ma. Chuchi works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products.  

Ma. Chuchi is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Ma. Chuchi has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 43-year-old married woman with five school-going children. Her husband Nzaro is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Beatrice has operated as a coconut vendor for the past five months; her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and passersby. She faces a major challenge in transporting her goods to the market. In the future, she dreams of establishing a shop to sell her goods from.

With this 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu, for easier access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 54 years old and married, with five children.  Matilde works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Matilde has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Matilde aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a business selling ice cream in the Philippines.

Nida requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

Nida has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 53 years old and married with four children.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lorna has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and earns additional income from motorcycle transport, livestock raising and food vending.

Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 56 years old and married with seven children.

Margarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Margarita has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 22 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains, charcoal and livestock.

Margarita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 22-year-old married woman with four school-going children. Her husband Kaulu is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. They have a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Mary's greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of theft where sometimes some of her items are stolen. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future.

With this 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap for her shop. She decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu, for easier access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She sells banana cue, rice cakes and other delicacies to the people in her community. According to Avelina, she earns about PHP 5,000 per month with her business. Avelina works hard to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients such as bananas, oil, and sugar. She hopes to continue supporting her family through her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as bananas, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en: Efrena is married with five children. She is 41 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Efrena buys and sells fruits to earn a living and has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, Efrena earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase additional fruits for resale like banana, avocado, sweet potato, guyabano and others. Efrena has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for three years. She is now in her 20th loan cycle. She is a good member of GDMPC. In the future, Efrena plans to save her returns for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Democrita

texts.en:
Democrita is 63 years old. She is married and has four adult children. Democrita is engaged in cooking native delicacies, such as steamed rice cake or "puto", "biko" (glutinous rice cooked in coconut cream with lots of sugar), "banana cue", and hot cakes. She has had this business for over five years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional ingredients, like sugar, flour, cooking oil, bananas and glutinous rice to be used in cooking native delicacies to be sold at retail.

Democrita joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to be used in making native delicacies like steamed rice cake, "puto", glutinous rice cooked in coconut cream with lots of sugar, "biko", and "banana cue"

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 35-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband Mkare is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. They have a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Pauline's greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Pauline has operated a coconut wine selling business for the past 11 years; her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and passersby. She faces a major challenge with transporting her products from point of purchase to point of sale. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business.

With the requested 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more wine for resale and buy more storage equipment. She decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu, because it helps people by providing loans.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut wine for resale and buy more storage equipment.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is 36 years old and married with two children between 16 to 18 years old. She lives in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. She owns a bar and has been in this business for three years, having started with meager capital. Since then, she has seen her capital grow to her great joy and hopes that it will continue to grow. Robinah wants to have a beer depot in the future and she is requesting a loan to buy a fridge for cooling her drinks at the pub.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for cooling her drinks at the pub.

loans.name: Niyingabiye Group

texts.fr:
Daniel est un commerçant âgé de 62ans qui habite  la localité de Mugutu de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Il fait le commerce de la bière locale depuis 26ans. Il commence cette activité alors qu’il était encadreur agricole. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 4e année primaire. Il est marié a Angèle et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 3 étudient.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 120,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bière locale à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« NIYINGABIYE»
texts.en:
Daniel is a 62-year-old merchant who lives in Mugutu, Gitega Province, in the center of the country. He's been selling locally made beer for 26 years. When he started this business, he was a farm supervisor.

He attended elementary school up to the fourth grade. He's married to Angèle, and together they have five children, out of whom three are studying.

He's seeking a loan of BFI 120'000 to bolster his working capital and purchase large quantities of local beer for resale, in order to turn a big profit.

He's a member of Niyingabiye Group.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of local beer for resale

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en: Genevive is married with 3 children. She is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. Genevive is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer for her crop raising. Genevive has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 1 year. In the future, Genevive hopes to improve her living situation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her crop raising

location.town: Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Kupukai Group

texts.en:
Clara is 49 years old and lives in Gweru. She is a widow who is bringing up four children along with two orphans (her deceased brother's children), all of whom attend school.

Her principal business is to raise and sell chickens. She has two employees and has been in operation for three years. Clara also makes an income from buying and selling foodstuffs in the local market, and earns rental income of $150 per month from a four-bed house that she lets out. 

The main problem she faces is the high level of competition, leading to low prices and profit for her chickens. Her ambition is to build up a substantial chicken rearing business - she wants to raise 1,000 chicks over the next five years. She will use the MicroKing loan to buy 150 chicks, together with associated feed and medicines.

She hopes that the profit from her enterprise will enable her to send her children to better schools and train them so that they can follow her into the poultry business.

loans.use: to buy 150 young chicks, feed and medicines

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a 19-year-old married woman with one child, who is not in school. She has a business of selling beer in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. Abraham's husband is a driver.

Abraham requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more beer for sale. She will use her extra income for building houses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 67 years old and married.  She has 6 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Ofelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ofelia has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from farming rice and livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dulce Amor

texts.en:
Dulce Amor is 30 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is married with 1 child. 

To earn a living, Dulce Amor has a business selling homemade polvoron. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. Dulce Amor has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase ingredients and additional equipment to be used for polvoron making.

Dulce Amor has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Dulce Amor would like to make her business become successful and known in other places.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and additional materials for polvoron making

loans.name: Willa

texts.en:
Willa is 55 years old and married, with 5 children. Willa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Willa has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine and raising livestock.

Willa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old.  She is married and has  4 children.   She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Vilma has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

Vilma is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Oet

texts.en:
Oet is 37 years old with two children. Her youngest child is still in school. She has been farming on her rice field for 17 years. She also sells fish to increase her family's income. 

Oet has been with VisionFund since 2010. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.en:
50-year-old Belarmina is a married woman with five children. Her husband works as a farmer and coconut gatherer.

Belarmina earns a living through basket-weaving. She has been engaged in this kind of business for almost 30 years. Belarmina also owns and manages a sari-sari store business. She sells items like soft drinks, canned goods and soap. She requested this loan to buy materials for basket-weaving and more items to sell at her store. Belarmina hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket-weaving and more items to sell at her store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 41 years old, married and has three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by running a store where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years and is applying for a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is widowed with 3 children. Lourdesita is 66-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Lourdesita is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the crops. 

Lourdesita has been a member of PMPC for 1 1/2 years. In the future, Lourdesita hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Nebert

texts.en:
Nebert is 41-years-old. He is married with one child and is responsible for two more dependents. They live in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to have enough sources of income to build a better house. 

He has been dealing in brick making and farming for the last five years and faces a challenge of little capital and the changing seasons which make it difficult for him to work, especially during the rainy seasons. Nebert needs the loan to buy fire wood for the brick making and to pay workers so as to increase on production.

loans.use: to buy firewood for brick making and to pay workers.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Lisa is married, 42-year- old and lives in Gala Ozamiz City. Lisa has four children who live with her.

To make a living Lisa owns and operates in the agricultural business sector. To earn a living, Lisa planted banana trees and after harvest she sell the fruits to her contract buyer. She has been doing this business for 5 years. 

Each month, Lisa earns approximately PHP 8,500 for this activities. She requested a loan for 25,000 to purchase fertilizer and other farm equipment.

Lisa has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Lisa hope to widen her banana farm for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize produce for selling.

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is 26-years-old, married to a man who is a driver, with one child who is not in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. 

Hadia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to order more charcoal for sale. She will use her extra income for building a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married with three children. Lucia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lucia is a farmer and grows rice and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers.

Lucia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve their living status.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed is a 47-year-old Ugandan who hails from Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is an Irish potato farmer who is married with four children between 7 and 20 years old and owns a semi-permanent house. He faces a problem of pests, diseases and expensive pesticides. He has been in this business for three years. He began by planting Irish potatoes on a small scale of around one acre. Over the years, Muhamed has accumulated capital that has enabled him to buy more land on which he is now farming. Muhamed wants the loan facility to buy Irish potato seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy irish potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en: Crispina is 37 years old and a married woman with three children between 2 and 14 years old. Crispina sells ready-to-wear clothes to the people in her community. She sells items like shirts and under garments. Crispina earns 7,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as shirts, socks and jeans. Crispina hopes for her business to prosper. She also hopes for her children to finish college and for her family to be healthy always.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shirts, socks and jeans

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 33 years old and married with four children. She has other dependents that she looks after and she lives with six people in her own home. Her family goal is to provide for her family needs. She has a business of used clothes, which she has been running for seven years and she strongly believes her business will grow in the future. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey is 19 years old, single and has no children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by running a stall where he sells toys, balloons and other items. He is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to his customers. Jeffrey joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy toys, robots and balloons to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 59 years old and married with five children. She lives in Migcawanay, Tangub City. To earn a living, Angelita has a stall in the public market of her town, where she displays her vegetables products like eggplant, amplaya, cabbage and others. Angelita had been in this business for about 18 years. Every month, she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of activity. Angelita is requesting a PHP 5,000 loan to purchase additional vegetables for sale.

Angelita joined GDMPC in the year 2008 and she is now in the second cycle of the loan. Angelita's plan is that in the future she can save from her returns for the renovation of her house for comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 46 years old, married, has six children and earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this line of work for two years and is applying for a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy more livestock to raise. She is working very hard to achieve her goals of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with no children. Her husband, who is employed, contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She has a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transportation. 

Asha has operated as a food vendor for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors, friends, and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase foodstuffs and utensils like plates, spoons, and glasses for her café. She decided to join Yehu because of access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and utensils like plates, spoons, and glasses

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with three children. Susan is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Susan is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 27 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase livestock feed.
 
Susan has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Susan hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Radegunda

texts.en: Radegunda is 53 years old. She is married with six children. Radegunda has a shop that sells ready-to-wear items like shirts and pants and home products like plastic wares, plates, and more. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional items to sell. Radegunda has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Radegunda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items like plastic wares and ready-to-wear items

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 38 years old with four children between 5 and 12 years old. He has been running a business selling used shoes for seven years. Patrick says the used shoes are a marketable product that people find easy to use and buy given the economic standards of the locals. He hopes to work hard to see his business grow into a big business. He is requesting a loan facility to enable him to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more second hand shoes to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and married nine children, seven of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for 10 years and is married to a doctor.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Aquilina works hard to support her family.
