She has a banana retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling firewood. Aquilina is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her stall.

Aquilina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in her stall

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en: Assumpta is 51 years old and the mother of two children, ages 29 and 32. She is looking after three children, as well as her husband who is now mentally handicapped. She owns a house in Hoima district in Western Uganda. She has a business where she sells fresh foods, which she has been doing for the past 11 years. Her business challenge is that fresh foods perish very fast. In the future, she hopes to have a big shop where she can sell all kinds of fresh foods. She is requesting a loan to buy bananas, oranges, and other fruits for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase fruits like oranges and bananas

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and is married with eight children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, snack foods, etc. to sell in her store.

Arlene has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from e-loading (sending mobile phone credits).

Arlene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, snack foods, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Genafe

texts.en:
Genafe is a married woman with three kids. Genafe is 25 years old and lives in Pan-taon, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Genafe is in an agricultural business raising pigs. She raises pigs to earn a living and has had this business for five years. 

Each month, Genafe earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feeds. Genafe has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Genafe hope to renovate their house and to expand her agriculture business raising pigs. She plans to raise five mother pigs to produce more piglets.

loans.use: to purchase feeds.

loans.name: Argene

texts.en:
Argene is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  Argene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  She  also earns additional income from selling firewood and charcoal. 

Argene is requesting a loan for 13,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more sacks to sell.  Argene has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF.  She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 31 years old . She is a single mother with one child. Juliet has a stall that displays her products like cooked viands, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for almost three years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy ingredients for the menu of the day and to save for the improvement of her stall. Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business so that she can pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the menu of the day

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 36 years old. She is married and has three school-aged children. 

Mary Grace used to engage in a service-based business giving manicures and pedicures to locals. Aside from doing manicures and pedicures, she is also engaged in selling ready-to-wear garments such as shirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to purchase additional ready-to-wear garments such as t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Mary grace joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear garments such as t-shirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 41 years old. She is married with six children. Cristina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional items like canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Cristina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Filadelfa

texts.en: Sixty-two-year-old Filadelfa is a married woman with four children. She lives in the town of Cortes, Bohol, with her family. She runs a multicab transportation business with her husband. This business has been running for eight years. Filadelfa also manages their sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like canned goods. She requested this loan to purchase spare parts and more items to sell at her store. Filadelfa hopes for their businesses to grow. She also hopes for her family to be healthy always.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with seven children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of selling ice cream in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more ice cream for sale. She will use her extra income for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ice cream for sale.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 44 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Renato plants three hectares of rice fields in the Philippines. He has been a farmer for 28 years. He earns approximately PHP 100,000 per crop, but he only bring home half of that because after selling the products, he has to pay his obligations to the the traders from the private sector who lend money with high interest rates to small farmers from villages.

Renato dreams of improving his family's standard of living. He wants to borrow a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides for rice farming. He hopes the loan will be a big help for him. This loan will allow him to not get a loan again from the traders. Instead of paying high interest rates to the traders, he will spend the money on food and education for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides for rice farming.

loans.name: Evangeline Solis Group

texts.en:
Evangeline is married with one child. Evangeline is 49 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Evangeline sells rice to earn a living, and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase additional rice to sell.

Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Evangeline hope to expand the business.

Evangeline is the leader of a three-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is from Abasha in the Samegrelo Region of Georgia.  She is 55 years old and lives with her husband Murad, their 27 year old daughter, and their two sons who are 25 and 23 years old.  Nunu’s daughter is unemployed and her sons serve in the Georgian army. 

Nunu works as a nurse at a local medical emergency company.  Along with her very busy main job, she is involved in the family agricultural business, which is led by Murad and is an important source of income for the family.  They have three milk cows and produce 45 kg of traditional Georgian cheese which is sold at the local market each month.  They also have a small pig farm with two pigs and they sell on average 24 piglets per year.  Nunu and Murad grow soy-beans and corn on family owned 1.5 hectares of land.  Only 20% of the harvested crop is sold at the local market, as the rest is used in to feed the cows and pigs.  The total average income for Nunu and Murad is 800 Laris, including Nunu’s salary. 

Nunu requested credit for planting nut-trees on 0.6 hectare of land.  The Samegrelo region is well-known in the country for nut-growing.  Harvested nuts are mainly purchased by wholesalers, who export them to Turkey.  With the loan amount, Nunu will purchase seedlings of nuts.  Also part of the credit will be used for cultivation and fertilization of the land before planting.  After a couple of years, Nunu will get the first harvest of nuts.  She will use the income to do house renovations, as well as to purchase new household goods in order to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase nut seedlings and to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Darlene

texts.en:
Darlene is 28 years old and married with one child. Darlene works very hard to provide for them.

Darlene runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy stocks of merchandise for her store.

Darlene has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, basic grains, detergent, and other groceries. 

In the future, Darlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more of her products, like fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jabbar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married, and has four children.

Jabbar has owned a shop for car accessories since 2000, where he sells and decorates cars.  He has had sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation, and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more items for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent and to add more items for his shop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is single. She is 45 years old. She lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City. Alice is selling herbal coffee to earn a living, and she has been in this business for more than five years. Each month, Alice earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (Php) from her herbal coffee selling. She is engaged in this business because it's very salable in her community. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 10,000. She will use the loan for the additional capital for her herbal coffee business to sustain her daily needs. She is in her second loan cycle. Alice has been a member of GDMPC this year. In the future, she will use the profits she will earn to sustain herself. Alice wishes that her business will progress.

loans.use: to purchase additional herbal coffee.

loans.name: Adawa

texts.en:
Adawa is 43 years old. She is a married woman with seven children who are in school. She has a business selling tomatoes and green vegetables in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for eight years.

Adawa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more tomatoes for sale. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 5 children.
Alicia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Alicia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Alicia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like snacks & beverages

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is applying for another loan to start a fruit juice selling business. She will use this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase a multipurpose blender and stock of fruits for making juice. In the future, Arafa hopes to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Arafa has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase a multipurpose blender and stock of fruits for making juice.

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 3 Group

texts.en:
Nur has a furniture repair business. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She has been in her business since 1990. She works out of a shop in her house. This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She wants to use this loan to buy more tools so that she can repair a greater variety of furniture. In the future, she wants to rent shop space and expand her business. The main challenge of her business these days is that, instead of repairing furniture, people sometimes choose to buy new.

Her plan for her family is to send her children to school through university. This is important to her because she only made it partly through high school.

loans.use: to pay for more tools to repair furniture

loans.name: Hassanein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with five family members, one of whom works.

Hassanein has been an owner of a shop since 2008, selling gifts and antiques. He has sufficient experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1500 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more goods. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more goods.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia  is 34 years old . She is married and has 4 children. Lucia  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages and, at the same time, she is into cooking and selling viands and other cooked food. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages and ingredients for the menu for the day.

Lucia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucia  hopes to improve her business and uplift her family's way of living.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in the store, and ingredients for the menu of the day

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is married. He is 46 years old with two kids. Rudy lives in Lilo-an, Bonifacio Mis. Occ. Rudy is operating his general store in his town to earn a living. He has had been in this business for more than 15 years. Each month, he earns 12,000 Philippines pesos (Php) from his business. 

He requested a loan in the amount of Php 15,000 to buy more goods to sell more items in his business. Rudy has been a member of GDMPC since 2009 and it's his second loan cycle. In the future, Rudy is hoping that his returns will be used to purchase more items for his business. Rudy's plan is that the returns from his work will support sending his two kids to school, as well as the needs of their family. Rudy is wishing that his business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his sari-sari (general) store

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is 42 years old. He is married and has 6 children. Billy has a stall that sells fish. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy fish.  Billy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Billy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, like fish net, for fishing

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a widow with six children. She is a food vendor. She sells banana and camote (sweet potato) cue, rice cakes and other delicacies. Jacinta earns 4,000 Philippine pesos per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar and oil. Jacinta hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products to sell, like snacks and beverages, candies and more

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is married. His wife is a housekeeper. Although he would have liked to have a child with his wife, Romeo has not been blessed with one. At his age of 61, Romeo is getting old. His dream is to have good health and savings for the future emergencies that will happen to him and to his wife. 
Romeo has been running a rice farming business in the Philippines for 25 years. He always assures that his crop is in good condition to get high yields. The risks he encountered in farming are drought, pests, typhoons and flood.  That determines how much he will earn.

Romeo is requesting a loan of P27,000 to buy seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care. Applying all of this in his farming will have a positive result in production, and will gain higher income. He hopes to attain his dream while he operates his rice farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
THIS BORROWER IS FROM IRAQ.  SHE IS 35 YEARS OLD, MARRIED, AND A MOTHER of FIVE CHILDREN.

HANAN is a tailor. She started working in 1995. She  professionally makes, repairs, or alters clothing, such as suits, coats and trousers for women. She has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well-known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $2200 loan in order to purchase a sewing machine and to add more goods. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and to add more goods.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin  is 42 years old, married, and has seven children.  Melvin  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  He  has had this business for five years. 

Melvin is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which he will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Melvin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell such as canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sanginmurod

texts.ru: Сангинмурод женат имеет одного ребенка. Жена домохозяйка. Вот уже шесть лет он занимается грузоперевозками предпринимателей из одного города в другой. У него своя автомашина ГАЗЕЛЬ. Его работа удовлетворяет его потребности. Он получает хорошие доходы и клиенты вечно довольны им. Сангинмурод хочет получить займ для ремонта автомашины и подготовки её к зиме. Он надеется получить займ и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Sanginmurod is married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been involved in freight services for entrepreneurs from one town to another for six years.  Sanginmurod owns a Gazel truck.  His work satisfies his needs.  He earns a good income, and clients are always satisfied with him.  Sanginmurod wants to obtain this loan to make repairs to his truck and prepare it for the winter.  He hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to make repairs to his truck

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 40-year-old single woman living with one parent in Lebanon. She has been producing traditional Lebanese food products for the past 10 years. She works from her home. In parallel, she works as a nurse in a local hospital in order to earn superior income. Today, she is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional products. She states that these purchases will help her increase her business productivity and therefore her profits by 10%. In the future, she plans to open her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Mira

texts.en: Mira is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. She started her hog-raising business a year ago. Mira built a backyard piggery where she raises pigs. She also has a vegetable garden. Mira requested a loan to purchase piglets, feed and seeds. Mira hopes to expand her business in the future. She also wants to see her children succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and seeds

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
Karar is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with seven family members, three of whom work.

Karar owns a shop that sells car paint and repairs tire wheels. He has owned the shop since 2009.  He has a lot of experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3,000 in order to make a ceiling for his shop and to purchase a diesel generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to make a ceiling for his shop and to purchase a diesel generator

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej is a 32-year-old young woman, and she is married with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Areej wants her family to live in better living conditions, so she wants to purchase new home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for her children, dining room furniture,etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Areej gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new home furniture which is necessary for home living. This will enable her to provide better living conditions for her family. Areej is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 8 Group

texts.en: Ferry has been selling clothes on credit since 2009. She is 35 years old and married with one child. She started to sell clothes door-to-door around her neighborhood but now her neighbors just come to her house to shop. The business is going well, and she can help her husband pay for their child's school fees. She has received more orders from her customers and needs the loan from VisionFund Indonesia to buy more clothes. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. Her hope is that one day she can have her own kiosk and sell a larger variety of clothes. Her hope for her child is that she can afford to send her child to school through university.

loans.use: to pay for more clothes to resell on credit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: 45-year-old Prima is a married woman with 5 children aged between 2 and 20. She is a basket weaver. She sells her products to store owners who sell native products. Aside from basket-weaving, she also raises pigs in her backyard. Prima sells the pigs at her town's market. She requested a loan to purchase materials for basket-weaving and additional piglets to raise. Prima hopes to support her children's college education through her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for basket-weaving and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Li-An

texts.en:
Li-an is a loving and hard-working mother of two. Her children are in elementary school. Li-an's priority in life is to give the opportunity to her children to study and achieve their dreams. She has no other treasure to give but education. 

Li-an manages her two hectares of field planting rice. She has been in this type of business for three years. According to her, she will not get tired of doing field activities because she loves her work. She said that it is the main source of income of the family.

Li-an needs additional working capital for her field. Her income from previous crops was not enough to buy all the farm inputs needed in rice farming. Now, Li-an wants to acquire a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, hybrid seeds of rice, insecticides, and herbicides. She will use the loan wisely and manage her farm well. She hopes to become a successful farmer and entrepreneur, as well as borrower.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, hybrid seeds of rice, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been working independently for the past ten years as a home painter. And today, he is looking to borrow $3,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase paint products as he is planning to start a new project and he needs to be prepared to satisfy his customer’s needs. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase paint products

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Harriet requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy, a married woman, has one child. Ludy is born January 17 , 1968. Ludy is 43 years old and resides in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ludy operates a motorcycle transport to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, Ludy earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase spare parts for the improvement of her vehicle. Ludy has been a member of GDMPC for a year. 
In the future, Ludy plans to save her earnings for the education of her children and to purchase purchase one more motorcyle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the vehicle repair

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат замужем. Детей не имеет. 15 лет она занимается швейными услугами. Она сама кроит и шьет национальные платья. У неё свои постоянные клиенты. Услуги портнихи и швеи очень востребованы и прибыльные.  В настоящее время очень востребована компьютерная вышивка на национальных платьях. Вышивки она заказывает другим швеям и это обходится ей дорого. Шафоат хочет  купить современную программную вышивальную машинку. Для реализации этой её мечты она хочет получить займ. Она благодарит вас за поддержку и ждет одобрения займа. Спасибо
texts.en: Shafoat is married and has no children.  She has been involved in sewing services for 15 years.  She cuts and sews national dresses and has loyal clients.  Tailoring and sewing services are in high demand and profitable.  At the present time, computerized embroidery on national dresses is in high demand.  Shafoat uses other seamstresses' services for embroidery, which is expensive.  She want to buy a current programmable embroidery machine.  She wants to obtain this loan to achieve her dream.  Shafoat thanks you for the support and awaits loan approval.  Thank you.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en: Abdel Karim is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and 6 children. He has been working as a construction laborer for the past 18 years, specializing in completing wall foliage work.  In parallel, he used to serve in the Lebanese army and is still benefiting from his retirement compensation.  Even so, he suffers from an unsatisfactory financiA. situation. So today, he is requesting to borrow $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A. l to purchase wood and cement for his business.  In the future he is planning to work closely with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy wood and cement

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 23-year-old Lebanese singe man living with one parent and three siblings. In 2008, he invested in a children's amusement park. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional leisure games. He notes that these acquirements will help him attract more customers of different ages. In the future, he is planning to add a small space where customers can enjoy quick snacks.

loans.use: buy games of amusement park

loans.name: Asala

texts.en:
Asala is 45 years old and has three children, none of whom are in school.  She is a widow.  She has a business selling dry fish in bulk oin South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.

Asala requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish for sale.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy dry fish

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is a basket-weaver. She is 54 years old and has 5 children. Tita uses "buri" (a type of palm) to make her baskets. People in her town sell dried buri and she buys from them. Tita requested a loan to purchase more "buri" and other materials for basket-weaving. Tita hopes for her business to grow. She plans to make improvements to their house with her profit.

loans.use: to purchase more "buri" and other materials for basket-weaving

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan is 45 years old.  He is a taxi driver around Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been running his business since 2002. Bayarsaikhan lives with his 2 children and wife in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent, which is located in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar.

Bayarsaikhan  wants to make adjustments to the walls of his ger, such as fixing the insulation, because his ger has been having heat-loss lately and has some breaks in it.  This is an essential problem for people who live in gers.  According his plan, Bayarsaikhan  will use less of the harmful fuel such as coal if he can make the repairs before this winter.   For this purpose, he needs some money support to buy the insulation materials ro make his ger warm.

loans.use: buy insulation

loans.name: Jamshid

texts.ru: Джамшед холост. Занимается услугами такси на протяжении семи лет. Этот вид бизнеса очень востребован, услуги такси требует тщательного ухода за автомашиной. Постоянная замена автозапчастей, замена масла, проведение техосмотра автомашин требует больших средств. Ведь таксист отвечает за жизнь своего пассажира. Наступает зима и следует заменить старые покрышки на новые, так как зимой дороги скользкие и постоянный гололед. Он хочет приобрести новые покрышки для автомашины, гарантировав этим жизнь и комфорт своих клиентов. Он надеется получить займ и продолжить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Jamshid is single.  He is involved in providing taxi services for seven years.  This type of business is in high demand, and taxi services require diligent car care.  Constant replacement of auto parts, oil changes, going through auto inspections require significant funds because a taxi driver is responsible for the life of his passengers.  The winter is approaching, and Jamshid needs to replace old tires with the new ones because roads are slippery and frozen in the winter.  He wants to buy new tires for his car, guaranteeing life and comfort for his passengers.  He hopes to get this loan and continue his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his car

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and is a married woman with 3 children aged 21, 17 and 13. She lives in the town of Cortes, Bohol, with her family. Her husband owns and manages a mechanic shop.

Yolanda makes baskets for a living. She uses "buri" (a type of palm) to make baskets. She earns about 6000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to purchase buri and other materials for making baskets. She hopes to be successful in her business so she can help her husband sustain their family.

loans.use: buy basket-weaving materials

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. She has been selling cosmetics and home products for the past 5 years. In parallel, she has been working in a locA. school since 2005 in order to supplement her income. She cooperates with her husband, who works as an architect, to be able to pay the family expenses. Today, she is asking for a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additionA. beauty products to sell.  In the future, she is planning to have her own beauty shop.

loans.use: buy beauty products

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, none of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). 

Harriet has a business selling used shoes.  She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 6 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products at the market by means of wholesale and retail.   She also generates additional income through roasting  maize and sweet potatoes.

Harriet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used shoes to resell. The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of second-hand shoes.  Her goals and aspirations are to start importing used shoes for her business and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. 

Harriet lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy second-hand shoes

loans.name: Cosmos

texts.en:
Cosmos is a married man with six school-going children. His wife is a business woman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Cosmos has operated a retail shop for the past four years.  In addition, he also runs a motorcycle transportation business. His potential clients are his friends, neighbors and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his shop to a wholesale shop in the future. 
	
With this loan for Kshs 60,000, Cosmos wants to purchase bags of sugar and maize flour for his shop. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because they charge low interest charges.

loans.use: buy sugar and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bulk fruits and vegetables to sell and to pay part of the price for the vehicle he purchased for work.

loans.name: Tsetsegdulam

texts.en:
Tsetsegdulam is 45 years old.   She lives with her family in a rented house which is located in downtown Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She runs a toy store in the bazaar called Narantuul. She has been doing her business for 5 years and has gained a lot experience in it. 

Already Tsetsegdulam has many customers, such as the parents and their lovely kids who always buy toys from her.  She needs some money to increase her working capital. It is very important for her to expand her business in the future.  

Tsetsegdulam is taking this loan to purchase a large number of toys from her suppliers to increase the inventory of her toy sales business.

loans.use: buy toys

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widow with three school-going children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Luvuno has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of theft.  She dreams of establishing a retail shop.

With this loan for Kshs 30,000, Luvuno wants to purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it has very few legal requirements to join.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with seven children who are all adults. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food her family.

Luvuno has operated a tobacco selling business for the past thirty years.  Her potential clients are her neighbors. She aspires to operate a retail shop.

With the 40,000 KES, Luvuno wants to purchase more stocks of tobacco for resale purposes. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loan facilities.

loans.use: buy tobacco

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, two of whom are in school.  She has a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for three years.

Hawa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more clothes for sale.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Altantulkhuur

texts.en:
Altantulkhuur is 27 years old.  She is a beautician in a salon. She lives with her son and husband in her father’s house, which is located in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar.   Her husband runs an inter-city passenger transportation service.  He has a lot of regular customers and they say that he is a good driver. 

Lately, his car has become more broken down and it's dangerous to serve the customers. Therefore, he needs to change its spare parts and some sections.  It will be good for his business earnings if he can make the repairs before this winter.  The loan Altantulkhuur is requesting will be used to purchase some new spare parts so her husband can make repairs to his car.

loans.use: buy parts to repair her husband's car

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene is 33 years old and lives with her 2 children and her husband in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She works as a bus conductor for a bus service company.  

Oyun-Erdene always tries to improve her living condition step by step. Therefore, she is planning to install a new electric heat furnace to replace the coal furnace which is being used currently.  She thinks this is a very economical and nature-oriented idea. Then, she will add insulation to the walls of her house because there is too much heat loss in her house.  The loan she is taking will be used to make adjustments to her old house. 

Oyun-Erdene needs MNT 3,500,000 to purchase and install an electric furnace and buy some building materials for insulation.

loans.use: buy and install an electric furnace and insulation

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка. 14 лет он занимается торговлей. Начинал он с торговли мелочами. А сейчас у него свой магазин с товарами ежедневного потребления. У него в магазине и продовольственные и промышленные товары на которые есть спрос. Товары он закупает оптом. В предпраздничные дни следует пополнить ассортимент товаров. Он хочет получить займ для пополнения товаров магазина к зиме и к праздникам. Он надеется получить займ. Спасибо.
texts.en: Huseyn is married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been involved in retail sales for 14 years.  He started with selling trinkets, but now has his own grocery store.  Huseyn has food and household products in his store, all of which are in demand.  He buys his merchandise wholesale.  Huseyn needs to refill his goods assortment in anticipation of holidays.  He wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of merchandise for the store, for winter and holidays.  He hopes to get this loan.  Thank you.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the holidays

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She is a widow.   Veronica has a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for seven years.

Veronica requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal for sale.  She will used her profits from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman with seven school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Nadzua has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge in harassment from the local authority because of the tree cutting and burning ban. She dreams of starting a cereals selling business.

With the 30,000 KES, Nadzua wants to purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it helps small-scale business operators through loan giving.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school.  She has a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more clothes for sale.  She will use her profits from this loan to open a very big shop for her business extension in the future.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам женат имеет одного ребенка. Жена домохозяйка. Ранее он занимался откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. На полученную прибыль он поменял вид бизнеса и стал заниматься продажей женских тканей. Два года как он занимается данным видом бизнеса. Этот вид деятельности он выбрал потому, что здесь больше общения. Он знает, что ткани всегда востребованы для женщин и всегда советуется с женой по выбору и востребованности  их на рынке. На полученный займ он хочет пополнить ассортимент товара и добавить зимние ткани. Он надеется получить займ. Спасибо.
texts.en: Rustam is married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Previously, he was involved in fattening up and selling cattle.  He used the profits to transition to another business and became involved in sales of women's fabrics.  Rustam has been in this business for two years.  He chose this business because it has more interaction.  He know that fabrics are always in demand for women, and he always gets his wife's advise on the choice and demand of fabrics at the market.  Rustam wants to use this loan to refill his merchandise inventory and add winter fabrics.  He hopes to obtain this loan.  Thank you.

loans.use: to buy winter fabrics

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Fatuma has a food stall business.  She has been in this business for less than one year and she works 6 days out of every week.   Fatuma sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and doing computer work.  

Fatuma has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy fresh fruits and vegetables like mangoes, pineapples and cabbages.   The main business challenges for Fatuma include seasonality and perishability.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a deep freezer to keep her fruits and also to start growing some of the fruits.   

Fatuma lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a divorced woman with five children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Nzara has operated a café for the past twelve years.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the lack of enough help in her café when she is working. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 25,000 KES, Nzara wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her café. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it does not have complex legal requirements to qualify to get loans.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her cafe

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old Lebanese, single man living with one parent and a sibling. His business income is important because it helps his family to pay for living expenses. He has eleven years of experience working in furniture manufacturing. Today he is the proud owner of his shop. He is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business tools and purchase equipment that is needed. He notes that these purchases will help him expand his work and increase his business productivity. In the future, he is planning to produce new and modern furniture.

loans.use: to renew his business tools and purchase equipment

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.ru: Асад женат имеет двоих детей. На содержание семьи он использует свою выручку и доходы от бизнеса. Его бизнес - это откорм и продажа крупного рогатого скота. А также он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Асад хочет получить хорошую прибыль для того чтобы лечить свою дочь. Его дочь инвалидка и она нуждается в помощь своего отца. Он запрашивает займ для покупки 3 голов быка с целью расширения бизнеса и получение прибыли для лечения своей дочки. Он заранее благодарен всех вас за вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Asad is married and has two children.  He uses his profits and income from the business to support his family.  His business is fattening up and sales of cattle.  Asad is also involved in growing agricultural crops.  He wants to make a good profit in order to provide medical care for his daughter, who is disabled and needs her father's help.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of three heads of bulls in order to expand his business and make a profit to care for his daughter.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Vyukakare Group

texts.fr:
Pasteur est un commerçant âgé de 38ans qui habite  le centre de la ville de Gitega au centre du pays. Il vend divers articles de boutique (haricot, riz, farine, souliers en plastique, etc) depuis 2ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Il est marié a Agnès et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 4 sont a l’école.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 180,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles de boutique (haricot, riz, farine, souliers en plastique, etc) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« VYUKAKARE»
texts.en:
Pasteur is a 38-year old trader who lives in the centre of the town of Gitega, which lies in the centre of the country. He has been selling various shop products (beans, rice, flour, plastic shoes, etc.) for the past two years. He is also a farmer. He did five years of primary school. He is married to Agnes and they have six children, of whom four are at school.

The Kiva loan of 180,000 burundi francs which he will get will allow him to increase his capital so that he can buy large quantities of shop products (beans, rice, flour, plastic shoes, etc.) and resell them for a large profit.

Pasteur is a member of the Vyukakare community group.

loans.use: to increase his capital in order to buy large quantities of shop products (beans, rice, flour, plastic shoes, etc.) for resale with the aim of making significant profits

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while the rest are too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Sidi has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and passers-by. She faces a major challenge in seasonality as during the rainy season it is to difficult to get the product. She aspires to operate a retail shop in the future.
	
With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers loan facilities to low income earners.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Bebyana

texts.en:
Bebyana is 38 years old with five children who are all in school. She is a widow. She has a charcoal selling business in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Bebyana requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal for sale. She will use her profits from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Абдулмумин женат имеет семерых детей. Жена домохозяйка. В бизнесе 21 год. Он занимается торговлей мужских сорочек. В бизнесе ему помогает старший сын. Он по оптовым ценам закупает на рынке «Атуш» товар и продает в рассрочку. Полученные доходы идут на расширение  бизнеса и часть на содержание семьи. С приближением зимы он хочет увеличить объем зимних сорочек и пополнить оборот товаров. Для этого ему нужны средства. Он хочет получить займ и закупить по оптовым ценам товар. Он надеется на получение займа. Спасибо.
texts.en: Abdulmumin is married and has seven children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been in business for 21 years and is involved in sales of men's shirts.  His oldest son helps him with the business.  Abdulmumin buys merchandise at wholesale prices at the "Atush" market and sells it based on installment plans.  He uses the resulting income to expand his business and support his family.  With the onset of winter, Abdulmumin wants to increase the volume of winter shirts and refill merchandise inventories.  He needs funds to do this.  Abdulmumin wants to obtain this loan and purchase merchandise at wholesale prices.  He hopes to get this loan.  Thank you.

loans.use: to refill merchandise inventory

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school. Rose operates a food stall. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 6 days a week. Rose sells her products retail at the market. She has requested a loan of 1200000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through a pub. The main business challenges for Rose include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to sell wholesale only. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a single woman with no children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Chari has operated a café for the past ten years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge in lack of good sales, especially during the rainy season. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a sack of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of easy accessibility to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Alfred has operated a café for the past eight years; his potential clients are the people who come to the market. He faces a major challenge of seasonality where by during the rainy seasons there are no customers. He dreams of owning a well established supermarket.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bags of rice, sugar and wheat flour for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get financial assistance to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice, sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla is a married woman and has three sons and two daughters. She has a wedding gown store and a beauty salon, which are the only source of income for the family. She wants to buy more wedding gowns for sale and a new beauty salon kit such as: hair and body creams, hair brushes, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Khawla gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new wedding gowns and she will have a larger collection to compete and sell more. Also, she will purchase a new beauty salon kit so she will improve her work positively and increase her income. This will enable her to provide better living conditions to her family. Khawla is photographed in her store.

loans.use: to buy more wedding gowns and a new beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 38-year-old married woman, living with her husband and three school aged children. Her income is essential; she’s supportive of her husband. She has been working as a nurse at a local hospital since 1995. 

Today, she’s requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay her children's educational school fees. She will also use the loan to purchase books and stationary. In the future, she plans to find another job and earn higher income in order to help her children continue their education properly, until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational school fees

loans.name: Zuhrakhon

texts.ru: Зухрахон замужем имеет троих взрослых детей и невестку. Более 18 лет она вместе со своей семьей занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов на своем посевном земле. Отходы от сбора урожая идут на откорм скота. Она хочет получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса на приобретение мелкого рогатого скота. Она надеется получить займ.
texts.en: Zuhrakhon is married and has three adult children and a daughter-in-law.  Together with her family, she has been involved in growing agricultural crops on her sowable land for over 18 years.  The income from harvesting goes toward feeding livestock.  Zuhrakhon wants to obtain this loan to expand her business by purchasing small livestock.  She hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Begmuhamad

texts.ru: Бегмухамад женат, имеет четверых детей. На содержании у него его родители. Он старается в достатке содержать своих родителей и семью. Для этого требуется огромный труд. Бегмухамад  вместе с сестрой занимается продажей искусственных цветов и детских игрушек. Весь товар он закупает оптом у оптовиков. Искусственные цветы очень востребованы так, как в настоящее время все уделяют внимание декоративному оформлению своих домов, а игрушки всегда нужны. Он хочет получить займ на оптовую покупку товара к наступлению праздников. На  праздниках можно получить хорошую выручку. Он надеется получить займ. Заранее благодарен.
texts.en: Begmuhamad is married and has four children.  He also supports his parents.  He tries provide well for his parents and family, but this requires an enormous amount of work.  Begmuhamad and his sister are involved in selling artificial flowers and children's toys.  He buys all of the merchandise at wholesale prices from wholesale dealers.  Artificial flowers are in high demand because currently, everyone pays attention to home decoration, and toys are also always needed.  Begmuhamad wants to obtain a loan for a wholesale purchase of merchandise in anticipation of upcoming holidays.  He can make a good profit during holidays.  Begmuhamad hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the holidays

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is 62 years old, married, and has three adult children.  He farms three hectares of rice fields. His 40 years in farming and his experience leads him to develop his expertise in farming. His dream is to maintain his business and leave it to his three children because he knows that he is getting old.

Romulo is proud that despite the challenges he encountered the love remains in his family. He is also proud that being a farmer, he successfully sent his children to school where they finished their education. 

Romulo’s capital for the sustenance of his farm is from the lenders. Romulo can now save some of his earnings but still not enough to provide for his needs in farming. Therefore, Romulo is requesting for a loan for 50,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, and insecticides and to pay his laborers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, and insecticides and to pay his laborers.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child, who is attending school. She has owned a tailoring shop since 1986. Her work specializes in sewing clothes and fixing the ruined ones. 

Today, she’s asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy a laptop, as she plans to make her own fashion designs using specific computer programs. In the future, she plans to expand her business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fruits like bananas, onions, tomatoes and oranges for her grocery business.

loans.name: Pulod

texts.ru: Пулод занимается скотоводством 15 лет. Этот вид бизнеса ему по душе. Его дети взрослые и помогают ему. Жена домохозяйка. Скот он кормит кормом, которого он выращивает сам на своем земле. На полученные средства он хочет приобрести 2 скота. Пулод надеется вашу помощь в расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Pulod has been involved in animal husbandry for 15 years and likes this type of business.  His children are adults and help him.  Pulod's wife is a homemaker.  He feeds livestock fodder that he grows on his land.  Pulod wants to use the obtained funds to buy two heads of livestock.  He hopes that you will help him with his business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 50-year-old Lebanese single man, living with one parent and sibling. He has been working as a freelance painter for the past 20 years. 

Today, he is asking for a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new painting products and tools. This will be his first Kiva loan, and he is sure that it will allow him to achieve remarkable growth with the coming year. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new painting products and tools

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a married man with six children, four of whom are currently enrolled in school. Pascal has run his own utensils and kitchen supplies business for the past two years. His primary customers are neighbors, local residents and travelers. Pascal's other source of income includes a side job as a teacher. He describes his greatest business challenge to be poor turnover and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Pascal will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase additional utensils, containers and kitchenware. He joined Yehu because their loans are easily accessible.

loans.use: to purchase additional utensils, containers and kitchenware.

loans.name: Badakhshon

texts.ru: Бадахшон вдова, имеет троих детей. Ей трудно прокормить своих детей. Она 12 лет занимается продажей обуви, калош. Продажа обуви приносит хорошие доходы. Она хочет обеспечить своих детей и улучшить свое жилищное условия. Она хотела бы получить займ для расширения  ассортимента товара и пополнение оборота. Она надеется на получение займа.
texts.en: Badakhshon is a widow and has three children.  It is difficult for her to provide for her children.  She has been involved in selling shoes and galoshes for 12 years.  Sales of shoes brings in good earnings.  Badakhshon wants to provide for her children and improve her living conditions.  She wants to obtain this loan to expand the merchandise assortment and increase turnover.  She hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en: Alaa' is a 24-year-old woman preparing to start a beauty salon. She is requesting a loan of $2,000 from FATEN, to be repaid on a monthly basis, in order to purchase salon materials including hair and body creams, hair brushes, hair dryers, etc.  Her business will offer her a good source of income and the opportunity to achieve better living conditions. Alaa' is shown in the above picture.

loans.use: to purchase a new beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina is a 30-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and only child. She has been selling beauty products for the past ten years. She works on a freelance basis, targeting a wide range of clientele. Today, she’s requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory of new beauty products. She intends to increase her business sales in order to earn a higher income. Her future plan is to open her own beauty centre soon.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new beauty products.

loans.name: Muzaffara

texts.ru: Музаффара замужем занимается посевом картофеля на 1,2 га земли. Если работать на земле от души то земля принесет хороший доход, считает Музаффара. Отходы от посева сельхозкультур идут на вскармливание скота. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес, но для этого нужны дополнительные денежные средства. Музаффара надеется получить займ и приобрести крупный рогатый скот.
texts.en: Muzaffara is married and is involved in sowing potatoes on 1.2 hectares of land.  Muzaffara thinks that if you love working on the land, then the land will bring in a good income.  Agricultural crop waste goes into feeding livestock.  She wants to expand her business, but needs additional financial means for it.  Muzaffara hope to obtain this loan and buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is applying for another loan to reinvest in his motorbike (boda boda) business. He will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase spare motorbike parts. In the future, Gilbert wants to operate a large automobile shop. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Gilbert has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase spare motorbike parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking tools and supplies.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine, a 35-year-old married mother of one child, owns a business selling various goods such as cosmetics, biscuits, bread, cooking oil, etc. This is her first successful year of operation, and the hours of her work are from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. She currently employs one person to help her.

Delphine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more more stock to sell. The additional profits will be reinvested in her enterprise and as savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as cosmetics, biscuits, bread, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Azim

texts.ru: Азим предприниматель широкого профиля. Он занимается и садоводством, и скотоводством и выращиванием селхозкультур. На земле он выращивает картофель и пшеницу, отходы от сельхозкультур идут на откорм крупного и мелкого рогатого скота, а садовые продукты он сушит и продает на рынке. Он хочет получить займ на расширение своего бизнеса, приобретения скота и семян для посева. Азим женат, имеет четверых детей. Все они находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. В бизнесе ему помогает его жена.
texts.en: Azim is a multidisciplinary entrepreneur.  He is involved in gardening, animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops.  He grows potatoes and wheat on the land and uses the agricultural crop waste for feeding cattle and small livestock.  As for garden products, he dries them and sells them at a market.  Azim wants to obtain this loan to expand his business, buy livestock and seeds for sowing.  Azim is married and has four children, all of whom are working in the Russian Federation.  His wife helps him with the business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds for sowing

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is married and her husband works as a charcoal seller. She has 7 children – 3 adults and 4 currently enrolled in school. Violet operates a livestock business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 3 years and her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Violet's other source of income includes a side job selling foodstuffs, such as maize flour and sugar. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition from other women in her village, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Violet will use the Kes 35,000 loan to add more livestock and goats. Violet aspires to run her own retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of their convenient meeting place and times.

loans.use: To add more livestock and goats.

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Restituto is a jolly person who has no other dreams in life than to become a rich man. He means rich in love. Restituto is 47 years old and married with four children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines, planting rice in his two hectares of field. 

Due to the increasing price of farm inputs like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides and herbicides, Restituto decided to borrow a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy the farm inputs and pay for the labor of land preparation and planting. He will have a big smile if he receives the loan because he will not think anymore of where he will get the budget to use in farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is married and her husband works as a farmer. She has 6 children – 4 adults and 2 who are currently enrolled in school. Kupha has run a small kiosk for the past 5 years, and her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Violet's other source of income includes earnings from her adult children. She describes her greatest business challenge to be low turnover and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kupha will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more inventory, such as soap, cooking oil and other essential goods. Kupha aspires to run her own retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of their convenience and flexibility.

loans.use: To buy more inventory, such as soap, cooking oil and other essential goods.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and only sibling. He has been working as a home painter since 2007. He works on a freelance basis, sticking with multiple projects. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase scaffolding and new equipment needed. He reports that these purchases will enable him to provide his services to more customers. In the future, he hopes to further expand his business and continue his work properly.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and new equipment needed.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man with 3 children, all of whom are currently enrolled in school. Simon operates a livestock business and sells his goods retail. He's worked in this business for 10 years, and his primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Simon's other source of income includes a side job selling cereal. He describes his greatest business challenges to be transportation and seasonality, and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Simon will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase goats, cattle and other livestock. Simon aspires to open his own kiosk in the future. He joined Yehu to access working capital and grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats, cattle and other livestock.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, who are still attending school. He has been involved in the construction field for the past 23 years. He is especially talented at completing wall foliage work (decorative finishing representing foliage). His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families with their business income. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy construction materials which will help him be more efficient at work. In the future, he plans to work on bigger projects.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rahimakhon

texts.ru: Рахимахон вдова. На воспитании имеет четверых детей. Воспитывать в одиночку очень трудно. Для содержания семьи после смерти мужа она стала заниматься торговлей детской одежды. Научилась как управлять бизнесом и получать хорошую прибыль. Она хочет получить займ для расширения и увеличения ассортимента зимней одежды. Она надеется получить займ и увеличить оборот своего капитала.
texts.en: Rahimakhon is a widow.  She has four children to raise.  Raising children as a single mother is very difficult.  To support the family after her husband's death she started selling children's clothing.  She learned how to run a business and earn a good profit.  She would like to get a loan in order to expand and increase her range of winter clothing.  She hopes to get a loan and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for sale

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman and her husband works as a teacher. She has 7 children and all are currently enrolled in school. Eunice operates a shop business and sells her goods retail. She's worked in this business for 12 years and was previously employed as a farmer. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Eunice will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase soap, cooking oil and other essential goods. Eunice aspires to continue expanding her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: To purchase soap, cooking oil and other essential goods.

loans.name: Hukmon

texts.ru: Хукмон женат и имеет четверых детей. В его бизнесе ему помогают его взрослые дети и жена. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов и пшеницы, также выращивает крупный и мелкий рогатый скот. Полученные доходы идут на содержание семьи. Ему нужны денежные средства на приобретение минеральных удобрений, семян и обработки земли. Он надеется на получение займ.
texts.en: Hukmon is married and has four children that assist him in running the business. Hukmon breeds cattle (large and small) and grows agricultural products such as wheat. He uses the profits to support his family. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds and to develop his land. He's hoping to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Nojood

texts.en: Nojood is a 32-year-old young woman. She is a tailor and her father is a worker with a decent salary. Nojood wants to improve her work by tailoring clothes of a high quality, so she wants to purchase a new sewing machine. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $1,200 from FATEN. When Nojood gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase a new sewing machine and improve the quality of her work so she will produce more and increase her sales. This will lead to an increase in her income. Nojood is a conservative woman, so her brother is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Kambizi

texts.en:
Kambizi is a married woman, raising one young child. For the past two years, Kambizi has run a shop and hotel business, in addition to a side job as a farmer. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kambizi will use her loan of KES 60,000 to purchase essential business supplies such as cooking oil and groceries. Kambizi aspires to purchase a posho mill for grinding grain into flour and to open another business. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: To purchase essential business supplies such as cooking oil and groceries.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Джамила замужем. Имеет троих детей. Бизнесом  занимается  четыре года. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Она на  рынке торгует женской и детской одеждой. Ей в бизнесе помогают ее сестры. Начала она свой бизнес  с малой суммы. Она хочет получить займ для расширения  бизнеса и оптовой покупки зимних товаров для продажи.
texts.en: Jamila is married and has three children. While her husband is away working in Russia, Jamila sells women's and children's clothing on the market. She's been in this business for four years and is assisted by her sisters. She began with a very small capital. She's asking for a loan in order to expand her business and stock up on winter goods for later sale.

loans.use: to purchase winter goods.

loans.name: Abubakarr's Group

texts.en:
In the photo above is a group of teachers from a primary school situated in Koidu/Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northen Sierra Leone to seek a loan. Like their teacher colleagues in other regions of the country, they have requested this loan so that they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges. They will repay the loan at the end of each month, using their monthly salaries. 

The leader of this group of teachers is Abubakar. Born in Makeni city, the 45 year-old is married and has two children who are attending primary school. With five years of experience in the teaching profession, Abubakar is requesting for this loan in order to buy food for the family and use the rest of the loan to pay his medical bills.

loans.use: to buy food for the family and use the rest of the loan to pay his medical bills

loans.name: Razok

texts.ru: Раззок женат имеет двоих детей. 15 лет он занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт в этом направление. В его бизнесе ему помогают его жена и сын. Полученный доход от своего бизнеса он тратит на содержание и улучшение благосостояния своей семьи. На полученный займ он хочет приобрести крупный рогатый скот.
texts.en: Razok is married and has two children. He has fifteen years of experience in cattle breeding. His family helps him run the business. Razok uses the profits to support his family and improve their welfare. He would use the loan to purchase some large cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this loan of KES 20,000 to purchase building and construction materials to build her retail shop. In the future, Eunice aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Eunice has been able to improve her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase building and construction materials to build her retail shop

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 30-year-old young man who is married with three sons. He is an office employee with a decent salary. In addition, he has a store for selling general goods such as home items, beauty products and groceries. He is looking to improve his store and increase his sales by purchasing more collections of these goods, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay.  So he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Abdullah gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more of these goods and have more collections for sale. This will increase his sales and increase his income, enabling him to live in better conditions with his family. Abdullah is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase home items, beauty products and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоат разведенная женщина и имеет двоих детей. В Центральном рынке города она торгует детской и женской одеждой. В бизнесе она всего один год. До этого она помогала по торговле своей сестре и недавно начала свое дело. Иметь свое дело-это уверенность в стабильном материальном обеспечении. Детям всегда нужна новая современная и сезонная одежда. Рафоат хочет получить займ для расширения ассортимента детской одежды. Она думает, что в займе ей не откажут и она сможет расширить ассортимент к наступающим праздникам.
texts.en:
Rafoat is divorced and has two children. She sells women's and children's clothing on the city's central market. Before starting this business a year ago, she helped her sister. 
Having your own business gives one confidence in a stable financial situation. 
Children constantly require new clothes. Rafoat is asking for a loan in order to diversify her assortment of children's clothing. She believes that her loan request will be fulfilled and hopes to have new goods for sale by the upcoming holidays.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this loan of KES 40,000 to purchase flour, soap and other essential goods. In the future, Purity aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Purity has been able to improve her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase flour, soap and other essential goods

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Uganda. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Teopista owns a food stall business. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days a week. Teopista sells her products at the market.
