Teopista has requested a loan of 1000000 USh from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, green paper and oranges. The main business challenges for Teopista include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to educate her children. Teopista lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of green paper, oranges, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman and has operated her own shoe-making business for the past two years. She sells her retail goods to neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwaka will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase shoelaces, soles and other essential supplies. Mwaka aspires to continue expanding her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: to purchase shoelaces, soles and other essential supplies.

loans.name: Ehsonkhoja

texts.ru: Эхсонходжа молодой энергичный парень. Он окончил школу с отличием и поступил в Таджикский государственный университет на факультет «Финансы». Для того чтобы продолжить учебу он должен оплатить годовое обучение, и к сожалению у него не хватает средств. Он  хочет получить маленький займ для оплаты обучения. Он надеется получить займ и продолжить учебу.
texts.en: Ehsonkhoja is a young and energetic man. He graduated from high school with honors and enrolled in the Tajik State University on faculty of "Finance." To continue with his education he has to pay his yearly tuition and unfortunately he does not have enough means. He wants to receive a small loan to pay for his education. He hopes to get this loan and continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition for education.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a single woman raising two young children on her own. Both children are currently enrolled in school. Dzame operates a charcoal business and sells her goods retail. She's worked in this business for two years and was previously employed as a clothing saleswoman. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Dzame describes her greatest business challenges as transportation and seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Dzame will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase 10 bags of charcoal. Dzame aspires to continue expanding her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 25-year-old young man.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.  He also has a home products sales store.  Naser wants to purchase more home products to have a better collection for sale, such as cups and dishes for different uses, dinning sets, etc. but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan for $2,000 from FATEN.  When Naser gets the loan, he will be able to purchase new collections of home products and have the ability to compete well with others, so his sales will increase and his income will improve.  This will provide Naser with better living conditions. 

Naser is photographed in his store.

loans.use: buy home products to resell

loans.name: Uwezo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Lucia, leader du groupe d’affaire «Uwezo », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 53  ans, mariée, mère de 2 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est  sociétaire d’un restaurant. Il y a  12 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  13eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 paniers de pommes de terre, 10 litres huile, 25 kg farine, Fanta, lait, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The customer, Lucia, who is leader of the Uwezo business group, is a 53-year old entrepreneur. She is married and mother to two young children, who are both at school. Her husband is unemployed. She is a member/shareholder of a restaurant. She has been carrying out small-income generating activities of this kind for the past 12 years. Nevertheless, she has just been given her 13th loan from Hekima. She will use this new loan to get fresh supplies: two baskets of potatoes,ten liters of oil, 25 kg of flour, Fanta, milk, etc. She would like to see her children grow up in comfort and grow her business. The customer is grateful to Hekima for its actions in favour of poor women who do not have access to classic banks.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of potatoes, ten liters of oil, 25kg of flour, Fanta, milk, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old and is a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has a business selling tea in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to purchase more sugar and glasses for her to operate the business. She will use the profit from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and glasses for tea sales.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es: El cliente Aquilino trabaja hace muchos años como agricultor, como el es propietario en el recae la responsabilidad donde se encuentra ubicado el lote agrícola en el Sindicato Estaño Palmito donde tiene la producción de papaya, plátano y cítricos para la producción y sustento de su familia. Entonces el cliente recurre a solicitar un préstamo el cual le ayudara en la plantación de papaya; comprara plantitas de papaya para poder hacerlas producir. El cliente es de sociedad media y persona del lugar con ganas de trabajar y empeñoso. Por lo que el credito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su familia y desarrollar mas la producción y su forma de vida ya que tiene 2 hijos dependientes a quienes tiene que mantener.
texts.en: Aquilino has worked as a farmer for many years. Since he’s an owner the responsibility falls on him.  He has a field located in the Sindicato Estaño Palmito where he grows papaya, bananas and citrus fruit to produce and for his family’s sustenance.  He has come by to request a loan to help with his papaya crops.  He will buy papaya seedlings to make them grow.  The client is a member of the middle class and a person from the place who very much wants to work and who is very dedicated.  The loan will be very helpful for his family’s progress and to develop more production and help his way of life since he has two dependent children to support.

loans.use: to buy papaya plants.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Harriet has a shop that sells film, cameras and phone batteries.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works six days out of every week. Harriet sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy phone batteries, cameras, film and sole tape. The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully-stocked dairy and to educate her children. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more phones, cameras, batteries, film and sole tape.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.fr:
Marceline habite au Sénégal dans la région sud ,elle fait le commerce de poissons fumés mariée depuis 19795, elle a 4 enfants.Avant de se marier ,elle pratiquait se commerce car elle habite dans une zone producteuse de poissons.
Marceline avec son commerce,elle soutien son mari pour les frais de scolarisation des enfants et la nouriture de la famille.Avec son commerce elle pense contruire en dur leur maison qui est un ancien batimen en banco.
texts.en: Marceline lives in the south of Senegal and sells smoked fish.  She has been married since 1979 and has four children.  She carried out this business before she got married because she lives in a fishing area.  Through her business, Marceline supports her husband in covering their children's education expenses and in feeding the family.  Through her business she plans to re-build their home from durable construction materials as it is an old house made from mud.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish to increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy home appliances

loans.name: Suzi

texts.en:
Suzi is 19 years old and is a married woman with two children, none of whom are in school. She has a business selling ice cream in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for two years.

Suzi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to purchase more ice cream for sale. She will use the profit from this loan for building a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ice cream for sale.

loans.name: Denyse

texts.en:
Denyse is 40 years old and is a window with four children aged between 4 and 22 years old. Denyse owns a business selling various African clothing. This is her 10th successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 8 am until 7:30 pm every day except on Sunday. 

Denyse has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more African clothing to sell. With any profit, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy African clothing to resell

loans.name: Perla Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Perla tiene 52 años D. edad, está casada pero actualmente no vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores, por lo que ya no dependen económicamente D. ella.
Doña Perla se dedicaba a la venta D. ropas usadas, aproximadamente desD. el año 2002, ella comenzó con el dinero que juntó trabajando como empleada D. una empresa en el país vecino(Argentina), capital que fue invertido en la compra venta D. ropas usadas, en el mercado D. abasto D. la ciudad, donD. en la actualidad ya formó su clientela, actividad que le da ingreso mensual para poder vivir dignamente con su familia.
Ella desea poder seguir creciendo comercialmente por lo que desea dedicarse ahora al rubro D. la despensa, y es por ello que acuD. hasta kiva y fundación paraguaya, solicitando un crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, y demás con lo cual podrá empezar su despensa y así abrirse camino.
texts.en:
Perla is 52, and married, but presently doesn't live with her partner. She has two children who are now adults, so they no longer depend on her financially.  

Perla sells used clothing, and has been doing this since approximately 2002. She started with the money that she saved working for a company in a neighboring country (Argentina). She used this capital to buy and sell used clothing in the city's public market, where currently she has already established a clientele. This work provides a monthly income that enables her to live modestly with her family. 

She wishes to continue growing as a business owner, so now she wants to start a grocery store. That's why she is approaching Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya, applying for a loan to buy foodstuffs, drinks, and other merchandise to start her grocery store, and in this way make her way in life.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, drinks and other merchandise.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 36 years old.  He is married and has five children aged between 1 month and 15 years old.  Celestin owns a motorcycle business and also sells products such as coffee, beans, potatoes etc. This is his tenth successful year in this business and he currently employs one person to help him. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. 

Celestin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his motorcycle business and to purchase more coffee, beans, potatoes, etc. for sale. Celestin hopes to earn more profit. With any profit, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family and he will be able to buy other motorcycles to help him in his businesses.

loans.use: expand his motorcycle business and buy more coffee, beans etc. to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old, married, and has eight children who are all in school.

She has a business of selling fish in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for nine years.

Elizabeth requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish for sale. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Marie Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 52 years old.  She is married and has two children aged between 8 and 12 years old. She is commonly known for selling various goods such as drinks, bread, cosmetics, etc. This is her fifth successful year in this business.  Her business hours are from 7 am until 8 pm every day and she currently employs 3 people to help her.

Gema has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing various goods such as drinks, bread, cosmetics, sugar, biscuits, etc. to sell.  With these additional goods, Gema will hopefully earn more profit, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to provide all the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Ne'ma

texts.en:
Ne'ma is a 32-year-old housewife, who wants to support her husband Baker in his business. 

Baker has a small grocery store located in Madaba that sells dried beans, snacks, and other food items. 

Ne'ma has applied for this loan to help her husband by buying more food items that have been requested by his customers for the Eid holiday next month. 

Because Ne'ma is a conservative person, her husband Baker has appeared in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more food items requested by customers for Eid next month.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 48-year-old man.  He is married and has seven sons and three daughters.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.   He is also a taxi driver. 

Sami wants to make some necessary repairs to the taxi he owns and drives to increase its efficiency and ability to work, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan amount of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Sami gets the loan, he will be able to pay for the taxi repairing expenses.  This will increase the taxi's efficiency and Sami will have the ability to work extra hours and increase his income so that he can provide to his family better life conditions. 

Sami is photographed next to the taxi he owns.

loans.use: repair his taxi

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is 43 years old and is a window with five children aged between 10 and 26 years old. She also takes care of two relatives. 

Hasina owns a business selling various goods in the market such as cooking oil, salt, rice, sugar, etc. This is her 14th successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 am until 6 pm every day. 

Hasina has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more goods such as cooking oil, salt, rice, sugar, beans, vegetables, fruits, etc. to sell. With any profit, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, salt, rice, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 41-year-old housewife who is married to Ismael and has six children. 

Besides her husband's retirement salary, Hanan started a year ago making artificial flowers and plants at home and selling them directly to customers and to decoration stores. 

Now Hanan has applied for this loan to buy more plastic material that is used in making those artificial decorative plants.

loans.use: to buy more plastic material for making artificial plants.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a hardworking  36-year-old man who is supporting four children under the age of nine years old. 

To be able to support his young family, Ismael opened five years ago a small shop to sell used furniture such as sofas, tables, cupboards, and so on. 

Now Ismael has applied for this loan to get a bigger store that can contain a larger quantity of furniture.

loans.use: to get a bigger store that can contain a larger quantity of furniture.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 33-year-old young man.  He is married and has five sons and three daughters.  He is a taxi driver.  This taxi business is the only source of income for his family.  

Mohammad wants to purchase a new engine for the taxi he owns and drives in order to increase the taxi's efficiency, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN.  When Mohammad gets the loan, he will be able to purchase a new engine for his taxi. This will enable him to work extra hours and increase his income and enable him to provide better living conditions to his family. 

Mohammad is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: buy a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is 42 years old.  She is married and has four children aged between 11 and 20 years old. Consolee owns a business selling second-hand clothing. This is her first successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 5 pm every day except on Saturday. 

Consolee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her clothes business. With this profit, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Muhawe, leader du groupe d’affaire «Zawadi », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 36  ans, mariée, mère de 7 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Elle est  sociétaire d’un restaurant-cafeteria.  Il y a  16 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  9eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 paniers de pommes de terre, 5 litres d'huile, 25 kg de farine, Fanta, 20 litre de lait, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Muhawe is the leader of the business group Zawadi. She is a 36-year-old entrepreneur who is married with seven young children, all in school. 

She runs a restaurant-cafeteria, and has been practicing small income-generating activities such as this for over 16 years. She just obtained her ninth credit from the Hekima MFI, and this new loan will allow her to purchase two baskets of potatoes, five liters of oil, 25 kg of flour, some Fanta, 20 liters of milk, etc. 

She wants her children to have a comfortable upbringing, and she would also like to expand her business. 

Muhawe wishes to thank Hekima for helping poor women who cannot turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase two baskets of potatoes, five liters of oil, 25 kg of flour, some Fanta, 20 liters of milk, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Abd Al Kareem

texts.en:
Abd A. Kareem, a hardworking, independent, 57-year-old man, has three daughters and two sons. 

He is a well-known person in A. Karak where he lives because he is running more than one business; one of them is an aluminum accessories workshop where they make and sell aluminum window frames and other stuff. 

This workshop has been successfully running for almost four years. Now Abd A. Kareem has applied for this loan in order to buy more aluminum materiA. and also improve the workshop decorations.

loans.use: to buy more aluminum material and also improve the workshop decoration

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 48 years old and is a window with one child who is 27 years old. She also takes care of three relatives. 

Florence owns a business selling potatoes. The hours of her business are from 6 am until 6 pm every day and she currently employs 2 people to help her. 

Florence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more potatoes to sell. With any profit, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy potatoes to resell

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 23 years old.  She is married and has one child who is 5 years old. She also takes care of a relative who is 17 years old. 

Antoinette is commonly known for selling charcoals.  Her business hours are from 7 am until 6 pm every day.  She currently employs 2 people to help her. 

Antoinette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more bags of charcoals for sale. With the additional charcoal, she will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and she can keep providing all the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Edith lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.   

Edith has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works six days out of every week. She also generates additional income through roasting maize and sweet potatoes.

Edith has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. The main business challenges for Edith include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a plot of land so that she can build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat, a 53-year-old divorced mother, is retired from the military. 

A year ago Nemat started making special decorations for the holiday seasons, like Christmas, New Year's, and Islamic holidays so she can be able to support her family of seven children. 

Now Nemat has applied for a loan so she can prepare herself for the upcoming holiday season here in Jordan by buying more material and items to make new decorations to sell.

loans.use: to buy more material and items to make new decorations for the holiday season.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 40 years old and is a window with two children aged between 8 and 15 years old. Eugenie owns a business selling various African clothing. This is her 12th successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 am until 7 pm every day except on Saturday. She currently employs 2 people to help her. 

Eugenie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more African clothes to sell. With any profit, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Francisca Del Socorro

texts.es: Francisca Del Socorro tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación León 2000, pues ha realizado muchas mejoras de su negocio gracias a los financiamientos. Inicio hace 6 años, con una pequeña de tienda de ropa usada debido a que el negocio no era muy rentable decidió quitarlo cuando su esposo se jubilo y fue con su esposo que decidió realizar este negocio. el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de huevos, fideos, queso, mantequilla, azucar, sal entre otros productos.
texts.en: Francisca del Socorro has been a Fundación León 2000 client for a long time.  She has made many improvements to her business thanks to the loans.  She started out six years ago with a small used clothes store.  Because the business wasn’t very profitable she decided to close it when her husband retired.  It was with her husband that she then decided to open this business.  The reason for the loan is for the purchase of eggs, noodles, cheese, butter, sugar, salt, and other products.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, cheese, butter, sugar, cinnamon and cornmeal.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 49 years old and is a window with two children aged between 15 and 24 years old. She also takes care of a relative who is 76 years old.  

Sharifa owns a business selling African clothing. This is her 2nd successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 am until 5 pm every day. 

Sharifa has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more African clothes to sell. With any profit, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family, she will be able to reinvest in her business and continue paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 36 years old.  She is married and has three children. Nadia owns a beauty salon. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 6 pm every day. She currently employs three people to help her.

Nadia has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her beauty salon business by buying more chairs and other materials. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business, and will be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: buy chairs and materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 26 years old.  He is married and has two children. He owns a small store selling vegetables, rice, beans, etc. and he has 6 years of experience.  His business is well-organized and he works from 6 am until 12 pm every day. Evariste currently employs 2 people to help him.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantities of rice, beans and vegetables to sell. With any profit, he plans to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: buy more vegetables, rice, beans, etc. to sell

loans.name: Claudia Marina

texts.es: Claudia Marina tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Ella con el crédito va comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, talla extra grande, chaquetas, camisetas entre otros. Tiene una gran variedad de clientes que siempre le solicitan variedad en sus prendas de vestir.  Ella quiere proporcionarle a su negocio todo lo necesario para que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos y obtener así más ingresos económicos para su estabilidad económica y bienestar familiar del futuro.
texts.en: Claudia Marina, 43, lives with her husband and son.  She will use the loan to buy pants, shirts, and skirts in extra-large size, jackets and t-shirts, among others.  She has a wide variety of customers who always request variety in her articles of clothing.  She wants to provide her business with everything necessary so that her customers will be satisfied to earn better income that way for her economic stability and her family’s future wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts in extra large size, jackets and t-shirts among others.

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Siuzike, leader du groupe d’affaire «Umoja ni nguvu », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 46  ans, mariée, mère de 3 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un officiel de l’Etat. Elle est  sociétaire d’un restaurant. Il y a  10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  8eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 paniers de pommes de terre, 10 litres de huile, 12 kg des farines, 2 casiers de Fanta, lait, tomates, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The customer, Siuzike, leader of the business group Umoja Ni Nguvu, is a 46 year old entrepreneur, married and the mother of three young children, all attending school. Her husband is a state official. 

She has a membership part in a restaurant. She has been practicing this kind of small income generating activity for over 10 years. Nevertheless, she just received her eighth loan from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to get supplies, 3 baskets of potatoes, 10 liters of oil, 12 kg of flour, 2 crates of Fanta, milk, tomatoes etc.

In addition she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and increase her business. The customer thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from classic banking.

loans.use: to purchase 3 baskets of potatoes, 10 liters of oil, 12 kg of flour, 2 crates of Fanta, milk, tomatoes etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 29 years old and is married. Vestine owns a studio business selling DVDs and CDs. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 6 pm every day. She currently employs two people to help her.

Vestine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her studio business by buying more DVDs and CDs for resale. With this profit, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business, and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy DVDs and CDs to resell

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es: La señora Felisa  se dedica a la venta de comida y también a la producción de leche; su esposo es chofer en transporte pesado. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de compra insumos como ser fideo, arroz, papas, carne, etc., para su negocio de venta de comida. Vive en casa de propia ubicada en la localidad de Palomar. Felisa es casada y no  tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que la cliente obtiene un crédito.
texts.en: Felisa sells food and is also a dairy farmer.  Her husband is a heavy transport driver.  She will use the money from the loan to cover the cost of purchasing ingredients like noodles, rice, potatoes, meat, etc. for her food vending business.  She lives in her own house located in Palomar.  Felisa is married and has no children.  This is the first time the client has obtained a loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food preparation.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata is 42 years old.  She is married and has six children. She owns a business selling softdrinks like Fanta. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 9 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her.

Liberata has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more drinks such as Fanta, juice, milk, etc. to sell. With any profit, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business, and she will be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: buy more beverages to resell

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista de 61 años, desde hace 6 años aproximadamente se ha dedicado a su pulpería en donde ofrece leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas, frutas y bebidas. Su negocio lo tiene establecido en su viven en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llega a comprar la variedad de productos que ofrece ha solicitado un crédito para comprar más mercaderías comestibles, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Juan Bautista, 61, has been running his grocery store for about six years.  He stocks milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, snacks, fruit and soft-drinks.  His store is located in his home where most of his customers come by to buy the variety of products he offers.  He has requested a loan to buy more groceries.  His only goal is that the business grow and to have more products available for his customers.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El  señor Carlos Alberto es una persona casada y tiene dos hijos  pero su esposa se encuentra  en otro pais desde hace tres años  y por lo difícil que es conseguir un trabajo; a logrado conseguir uno pero este no le alcanza para poder ayudar a su familia aquí en Bolivia, el señor trabaja en una empresa  como chofer de camión de repartición  y el sueldo que el gana es para solo la sustentación de sus hijos y de el.
 
EL Señor Carlos Alberto vive en la zona del plan 3000 a unos 30 minutos de la zona central es por este motivo que el necesita el préstamo para reparar su auto que el utiliza para poder moverse hasta su trabajo ya que el mismo queda al otro lado de la ciudad la empresa en la que trabaja  y así se pueda mejorar su calidad de vida, y llevar también a sus hijos al colegio recogerlos y evitar que les pueda suceder algo peligroso.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is married and has two children but his wife has been in another country for the last three years because of the difficulty in finding employment.  She’s managed to find one but it does not produce enough to help her family here in Bolivia.  Carlos works as a delivery truck driver for a firm and the salary he earns is barely enough for his and his children’s sustenance.

Carlos Alberto lives in the Plan 3000 zone about 30 minutes from the central zone and this is why he needs a loan to repair his car that he uses to get to work which is located on the other side of the city in the firm he works for.  This will improve his quality of life and he’ll also be able to take his children to school and pick them up keeping them safe from anything dangerous that could happen to them.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Rosa Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, tiene una hija de 3 años, vive en casa de sus padres en un barrio de la ciudad de Itá. Ella desciende de una familia de artesanos, pues su madre es reconocida en el país y a nivel internacional por su don de artesana en barro.
La señora Rosa heredó dicha profesión de su madre, desde los 9 años de edad se dedica a esta actividad, produce diversas figuras en barro como por ejemplo palomitas, mujer paraguaya, sapo de orquesta, pesebres y otros, los cuales vende en el país y exporta al extranjero.
solicita el préstamo para la compra de arena ya que se acerca fin de año y desea prepararse para producir pesebres de diferentes tamaños y diseños. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante, es muy sacrificada y talentosa en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is 27 year old, single, and has a three-year-old daughter. She lives with her parents in a neighborhood in the city of Itá. Rosa comes from a family of artisans. Her mother is well-known throughout the country and on an international level while her father is a neighborhood artist.

Sra. Rosa inherited her talent for this profession from her mother. Since the age of 9, she has been making a variety of clay figures such as doves, Paraguayan women, toads, orchestras, Nativity scenes, and other objects. She sells her works within the country and also exports them abroad.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy sand. Since the end of the year is approaching, she wants to produce Nativity scenes of various sizes and designs. She is an enterprising individual who has the desire to succeed. Rosa is talented in her work and also willing to make sacrifices.

loans.use: to purchase sand for her artistic works.

loans.name: Esmeralda De La Concepcion

texts.es: Esmeralda posee una pulpería ubicada en su vivienda tiene 21 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y ha sido gracias a la cual ha dado alimento y estudio a sus hijos, es una mujer emprendedora a pesar de que ha sobrellevado cosas difíciles en su vida sabe que es muy importante para ella el obtener este ingreso para su hogar.  Ella se levanta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche el entusiasmo que le brinda a su clientes es algo que a ellos les gusta. El crédito es para la compra de azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite, huevos, crema, pan, fideos, fósforos, papel higiénico y sopas.
texts.en: Esmeralda has a home-based grocery store; she’s been in this line of work for 21 years and it’s been the source of nourishment and education for her children.  She’s an enterprising woman who despite overcoming difficult things in her life knows that it’s very important for her to earn this income for her home.  She rises daily at 7am and works until 9pm.  The enthusiasm with which she greets her customers is something they like.  The loan is to buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, eggs, cream, bread, noodles, matches, toilet paper and soup.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Franklin Rosemberg

texts.es: El señor Franklin  nacido Santa Cruz, es soltero, el es de ocupación chofer, tiene su casa en la por la  angostura, a 30 km de el Torno, tiene su propia movilidad, en la cual el trabaja en la ciudad y también hace el recorrido de  el Torno y Santa Cruz, y es su primer crédito que esta trabajando con emprender, mediante una promoción que se le hizo, ya que fue la única institución que le dio una mano para poder acceder al crédito, con el dinero del créditos comprara una motocicleta para trabajar y así mejorar  sus ingresos económicos,  por lo cual esta muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Franklin was born in Santa Cruz.  He’s single and a driver by profession.  He has his house near La Angostura, 30 kilometers from El Torno.  He owns his vehicle that he works in the city and also on the El Torno-Santa Cruz route.  This is his first loan with Emprender.  He got it through a special promotion he received since it was the only institution that lent him a hand in acquiring a loan.   He will use the money from the loans to buy a motorcycle to work and improve his income.  He is very grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.fr: Madame Mairam  est une dame de 51 ans  qui vit dans l’une des localités du territoire Sénégalais. Elle est mariée et s’active depuis 10 ans dans le commerce et  la vente de fruits de mer, d’huile de palme, de balaies et de poisons séchés. Elle a choisi cette activité par opportunité en collaboration avec une amie basée dans une région du pays qui lui envoie les produits. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2003 ou elle a déjà remboursé 4 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits qu’elle commercialise. Son but est de renforcer son stock de produits afin de mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mairam is a 51-year-old lady who lives in a town in Senegal.  She is married and has been working in commerce for 10 years.  She sells seafood, palm oil, brooms and smoked fish.  She chose this business because she had the opportunity to work in cooperation with a friend based in another region of the country who sends her products.  Mairam has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since May 2003 and she has already repaid four previous loans.  She is requesting this loan for 100,000 francs to buy products to sell.  Her goal is to strengthen her stock of products in order to make better profits from her retail business.

loans.use: to buy products to re-sell

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: El señor Hilarión nació  en Chuquisaca, el se dedica al reparado de automóviles es chapista hace mas de 10  años el vive en la angostura, a 30km de el torno convivía  con la Sra. Hermelinda y tiene  4 hijos pero ella lo abandono ya que se fue a trabajar al exterior a buscar mejor calidad de vida, el vive en casa propia, el destino del crédito es para comprarse una motocicleta para trasladarse de un lugar a otro ya que por su y trabajo tiene bastante distancia que recorrer,  el no tiene ningún crédito con  ninguna financiera, es el primer crédito que esta sacando con emprender, ya que fue la única institución que le ha dado una mano, para mejorar su calidad de vida y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Hilarión was born in Chuquisaca.  He’s been an auto body repairman for over ten years.  He lives in La Angostura about 30 kilometers from El Torno.  He used to cohabit with Hermelinda and he has four children but she abandoned him to go find better employment abroad.  He lives in his own house and the loan will be used to buy a motorcycle to get from place to place because his work demands his traveling great distances.  He has no loans with any other credit institution.  This is the first loan he’s taken out with Emprender since it was the only institution that gave him a hand to improve his quality of life.  He is very grateful for the opportunity that’s been granted him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Alicia Fotunata

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Alicia; es  casada, la socia tiene 46 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos,la socia sigue trabajando en su restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,ella quiere seguir ampliando y mejorando el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras y tambien para implementar el restaurant comprando ollas y sartenes.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en: Alicia, 46, is married and has two children.  She continues working in her restaurant.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners from 9am until 7pm.  She wants to continue expanding and improving the restaurant.  She’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook like chicken, meat and vegetables and also to buy restaurant equipment like pots and pans.  She is very grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meals and also to buy equipment, like pots and pans, for the restaurant.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos  es un profesor que trabaja desde hace 10 años tiene edad 56 años. El no tiene hijos dependientes, y en la actualidad cuenta con problemas con su esposa. El señor Carlos trabaja en un colegio muy lejos de su casa que queda a 45 minutos, el se transporta en vehículos de servicio público,  pero a veces no puede llegar a su trabajo cuando hay paros de transporte y bloqueos que son muy frecuente; Carlos tiene un vehículo pero no se encuentra en buenas condiciones, y el cree que podría trabajarlo incluso como de taxi, para ello el necesita un crédito para poder reparar su vehículo y así poder sortear todos los obstáculos que a veces le impiden llegar a su fuente de trabajo, asi como también tener la oportunidad de poder mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en: Carlos, 56, is a teacher and has been working for the last ten years.  He has no dependent children and is currently having problems with his wife.  Carlos works at a school that’s quite far from his house; it’s 45 minutes away.  He uses public transportation to get around but sometimes when there are strikes and street demonstrations which are quite frequent he’s unable to get to work.  Carlos owns a car but it’s not in good running order and he thinks that he’d even be able to put it into work as a taxi but to do so he needs a loan to repair it to be able to get around all the obstacles that impede his getting to work as well as having an opportunity to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Alegrias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALEGRIAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Sofía. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de frescos, tienda de barrio, venta de queso, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de mochilas, ayudante de albañil, venta de fruta.

La señora Sofía  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace un año atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de su prima. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra fideo, arroz, azúcar, etc.) que comprará de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el area de salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Juana ya que se encontro en consulta médica
texts.en:
The “Alegrías” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Sofía.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have fruit smoothie sales, neighborhood store, cheese sales, food sales, grocery sales, backpack sales, bricklayer helper and fruit sales.

Sofía indicates that this is the first cycle she’s worked with Pro Mujer having joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She has a neighborhood store that she’s been operating for a year having learned this line of work from her cousin.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital.  She will buy noodles, rice, sugar etc. in the markets and then resell in her store.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family in the best way possible since she’s in a common law relationship and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

Juana does not appear in the photo because she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha Lorena tiene más de 19 años con su negocio que es la venta de ropa usada. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en mercancía que es pantalones, camisolas, shorts, faldas, camisas, trajes para damas y caballero y además ropa para niños. Martha no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión que a su negocio le está haciendo falta es por eso que desea este crédito para comprar materia prima. Martha tiene algunos desafíos como es perdidas en algunas prendas de vestir que aparecen dañadas y ellas no las vende, pero a pesar de esto siempre está saliendo adelante.
texts.en: Martha Lorena has had her used clothes sales business for over 19 years.  She’s asking for a loan to buy more merchandise: pants, t-shirts, shorts, skirts, shirts, women’s and men’s suits and also children’s clothes.  Martha does not have the necessary funds to make this business investment so she’d like this loan to buy her raw materials.  Martha faces a few challenges like losses due to items of clothing that arrive damaged and are unsellable; despite this though she’s always moving forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Olinda; es  conviviente; la socia tiene 31 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos,la socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de panaderia,pero ahora se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos,ella no le fue tan bien en el negocio de panaderia y es por eso que decidio cambiar al negocio de crianza de animales,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacara adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pollos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en: Olinda, 31, has a spouse and two children.  She used to have a bakery but now raises animals like chickens.  She didn’t do too well in the bakery business and that’s why she decided to change her business to animal raising.  She wants to move her children forward with this business.  She also wants to expand and improve the business raising chickens so is asking for a loan to buy chicks and feed for them.  She is very grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Limousine Group

texts.en:
Moses, who is in his late 20s, is single with one child who is in a baby class. 

He has been running a cosmetics business since 2008. He works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be his first loan in this group, and he wants to use it for increasing his cosmetics stock. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group,"Limousine," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase his cosmetics stock.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: El sr. Luis vive en la zona del plan 3000 en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el se dedica al transporte publico desde hace 10 años en su vehículo propio. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de sabanas y almohadas. El sr. Luis esta en su tercer crédito con la institución, su esposa también es cliente de emprender pero ella trabaja con bancos de emprendimiento donde ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago. El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de material de construcción  para terminar de construir el piso de su domicilio. El sr. Luis es una persona responsable al igual que su esposa y con muchas ganas de superación, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the Plan 3000 zone in his own house with his wife and four children who are school age.  He has worked in public transportation for the last 10 years using his own vehicle.  His wife sells sheets and pillows.  Luis is in his third loan with the institution and his wife’s also an Emprender client but she works with communal banks where she’s demonstrated good payment behavior.  

The loan he’s requesting is to buy building materials and supplies to finish building the floor in his house.  Luis is a responsible person like his wife who very much wants to get ahead in life.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to finish installing flooring.

loans.name: Anielka Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Anielka Elizabeth tiene 23 años, es madre soltera y con mucho sacrificio ha sacado adelante a su hijo de 3 años. Tiene su actividad que es una pulpería, desde hace mas 3 años es una mujer trabajadora y gracias a su esfuerzo tiene todos lo que posee hasta los momentos. El financiamiento es para la compra de leche, huevos, arroz, frijoles, aceite, galletas, sopas, enlatados y fideos. Desea comprar más productos para así vender más y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Anielka Elizabeth, 23, is a single mother.  With much sacrifice she’s managed to support her 3-year-old son.  She has had a grocery store for three years.  She’s a hardworking woman and thanks to her efforts she has everything she owns to date.  The loan is to buy milk, eggs, rice, beans, oil, cookies, soup, canned goods and pasta.  She wants to buy more products to sell more and earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Julia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Julia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es la fabricacion de tortillas, tiene vaR. años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para empezar su produccion, muchos clientes llegan a comprar desde las 6 de la mañana, este tipo de alimento en nuestro pais se consume con los tres tiempos de comida.
Julia es madre de 5 hijos  los cuales ya son mayores de edad y que en ocaciones le ayudan a repartir sus tortillas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de sus tortillas, en estos momentos los pedidos son mayores y no tiene suficiente inventario para cubrir con la demanda.
Julia en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
texts.en: Julia’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work which is making tortillas.  She’s been in this line of work for many years. Her business is home-based.  She rises daily at 4am to start her production.  She has many customers who come by at 6am to buy.  This type of food is consumed three times a day in our country.  Julia’s the mother of five children who are adults now and sometimes help her deliver the tortillas.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials to make tortillas because she currently has pending orders that are large and she does not have enough inventory on hand to meet demand.  In her free time Julia goes to church.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder and firewood.

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARTESANAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Villa Adela, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda, venta de medicina natural, confección de poleras, elaboración de mantas, venta de herramientas, elaboración de macramé, confección de poleras.

La señora Juana  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido en macrame que viene trabajando hace un año atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de su amiga. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de hilo.) que comprará de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en: The 'Artesanas' (Craftswomen) community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office. The group has seven members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Juana. The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: running a store, selling natural medicines, making tops, making blankets, selling tools and making macramé products. Juana tells us that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer and she joined through an invitation from a loan officer. She currently has a business making products from macramé. She has been in this business for one year and learned the trade from her friend. Juana will use this loan to increase her capital (buying threads). She will buy these supplies in the market and then sell her products to order. This work allows her to make money to support her family. She is married and has three children. When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana replied that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy threads

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y además disfruta de tener este negocio que le ha generado los ingresos necesarios. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, además de este negocio también se dedica a la  crianza de aves, Maria siempre esta innovando en su negocio pues ella siempre está pensando en mejorar sus ganancias cada día. Este financiamiento es para la compra de fertilizantes, herramientas necesarias para sembrar entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Ines is 57 years old.  She is a very tenacious woman who enjoys her business which has made her the income she needs.  She sells fruit and vegetables and also raises farmyard birds.  Maria is always innovating in her business as she is always thinking of how to improve her profits every day.  This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and tools that she needs to sow crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and tools she needs for sowing crops

loans.name: Mbacké

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbacké est un homme marié de 44 ans qui évolue dans le commerce depuis qu’il a quitté les bancs de l’école. Il est surtout spécialisé  dans la vente de prêts à porter, d’habits de femmes, de chaussures et sacs. Durant les périodes de fête et  de rentrée scolaire son activité connait un essor considérable. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de marchandises  pour  pouvoir répondre a la demande  croissante de sa clientèle  en cette période de veille de rentrée  des classes et de fête de Tabaski. Son objectif est d’améliorer ses gains financiers  pour mieux prendre en charge ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en: Mbacké is a married man of 44 who has been working in commerce since he left school. In particular, he specializes in selling ready-to-wear clothes, women's clothes, shoes and bags. During holiday periods and the back-to-school period his business increases considerably. He has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since July 2011. He is requesting this loan for 150,000 francs to buy merchandise so that he can respond to the growing demands of his customers during this period which precedes the start of the school year and the Tabaski (Eid al-Adha) holiday. His goal is to improve his earnings so that he can better take care of his social needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and bags to re-sell

loans.name: Pamoja S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Pamoja Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
George is the facilitator of the Pamoja SHG Group. He takes care of ten children at home with his wife. He joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, George had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest six bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, George will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Pamoja SHG Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the photo, George is pictured with his group members; the field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Populares Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POPULARES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Tatiana es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: pintado de cuadros, taller de mantas, costura de edredones, costura de chalecos, ayudante de costura.

La señora Tatiana,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga de la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de pinturas que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pinturas) que adquirirá de las agencias y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en las galerías. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Populares” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office.  The group has six members and is run by a board of directors which has Tatiana as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: painting pictures, making blankets, sewing comforters, sewing waistcoats and working as a sewing assistant.

Tatiana says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for one year.  She joined the institution through an invitation from a friend in her area.  She currently has a business making paintings which she has been working in for some years.  She learned this business from her mother.

Tatiana will use her loan to increase her capital (buying paints).  She will buy these supplies from agencies and, after she has finished her paintings, she will sell them in galleries.  This work allows her to make money with which to support her family.  She is married and has five children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Tatiana replied that she likes the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy paints

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Naranjos lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Lino de 43 años quien vende frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años con unos cuantos ahorros luego empezó a prestar y su negocio ha ido creciendo. El utiliza el crédito en la compra de mercadería y especialmente en esta época que suben las ventas.
Los otros integrantes Juana Francisca de 26 años se dedica al comercio de cosméticos Avon y Francisca se dedica al comercio de frutas.
texts.en:
The “Los Naranjos” (Orange Trees) group is made up of three hardworking, entrepreneurial people. One of them is Lino, 43, who has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past five years with some of his savings. Later he started to borrow, and his business has been growing. He uses credit to purchase merchandise, especially during times when his sales increase. 

The other members of the group are Juana Francisca who is 26 and makes her living selling Avon cosmetics; Francisca makes her living selling fruits.

loans.use: to purchase harvests of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Weumba Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weumba Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Stephen is the facilitator of the Weumba Group. He takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Stephen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Stephen was only able to harvest three bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Stephen will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Weumba Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the picture, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Maria De La Concepción de 46 años, una mujer que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento en su negocio. Su negocio es una brindar el servicio de fotocopiadora está ubicada en vivienda. Inicio hace 11 años con su negocio y con la ayuda de su esposo, pero lamentablemente el falleció y ella busco la forma de sobrevivir. Tiene dos hijos uno mayores de edad, Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de papel, tinta, pago de luz entre otros. Su sueño es incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
María De La Concepción is 46, and has ambitions of seeing her business grow. Her business is providing photocopying services from her home.

She started her business eleven years ago, with her husband's help; but unfortunately he passed away, and she looked for a way of supporting herself. 

She has two adult children. She is applying for the loan in order to buy paper and ink, to pay the electricity bill, and for other expenses. Her dream is to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy paper, ink, and pay for electricity.

loans.name: 1º De Mayo Dos Group

texts.es:
El banco D. emprendimiento 1º D. MAYO DOS entrando a su segundo ciclo conformado por 12 integrantes que viven en la zona del km 9, los socios cuentan con negocio y actividad propia.
La Presidenta es la Sra. Ana, ella tiene 28 años D. edad,  su actividad es la venta D. víveres y diferentes productos D. primera necesidad  en su mismo domicilio  ella tiene una tienda D. barrio muy surtida donD. ofrece variedad D. productos a sus clientes y por ser la tienda en una zona muy concurrida tiene muchos clientes, ella esta casada con el sr. Saúl el cual es chofer, lleva ya muchos años en esta actividad  y tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, son personas jóvenes con ganas D. superación que se esfuerzan día a día por dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos , con dinero del crédito la Sra. Ana comprara mercadería al por mayor como ser refrescos, dulces, galletas, variedad D. productos para surtir su tienda y D. esta manera incrementar su capital D. trabajo.
                                                                                                            Los señores están muy agradecidos con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo para poder crecer en su negocios y actividades.
texts.en:
The communal bank "1º D. MAYO DOS" is entering its second loan cycle.  The group has 12 members who live in the area near the 9km marker.  These members each have their own businesses.

The president of the group is Ana.  She is 28 years old, and has a business selling food and other necessities in her house.  She has a neighborhood store that is well stocked where she offers a variety of products to her customers.  Because the store is located in a very busy area, she has a lot of customers.  She is married to Saúl, who works as a driver, and she has had this business for many years.  She and her husband have 3 school-aged children. They are young people who have a strong desire to succeed, and so they work hard each day to proviD. a better future for their children.  With the money from this loan, Ana will buy merchandise at wholesale, including: soft drinks, sweets, cookies, and a variety of other products to stock her store.  This way she can increase her working capital. 

The members of this group are very grateful to our organization for trusting in them and providing them with support so that they can grow in their businesses and activities.

loans.use: to buy cookies, soft drinks and sweets to stock her store

loans.name: Bethania Group

texts.en:
Esther, who is in her mid 70s, is a widow with six children, but only one stays with her; the rest are independent. 

She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy herself clothes, pay household expenses and increase the food stock, and she has paid back all her loans successfully.  

She wants a loan to expand the place where she sells her food since it was small. Her dream is to one day be able to build herself a good house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Bethania," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To expand the place where she sells her food.

loans.name: Cordillera De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORDILLERA DE LOS ANDES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Cristina es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, compra y venta de ganado, tejido de mantas, carnicera de corderos, producción de canastas para flores.

La señora Cristina,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ganado que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las ferias del área rural y posteriormente lo venderá en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene once hijos.
texts.en:
The "Cordillera de los Andes" communal association will begin its first loan cycle with the Pro Mujer institution, through the Panamericana office.  It is made up of seven members, and is run by a board, of which Cristina is the president. 

The businesses that the members of communal association carry on are varied, and include: neighborhood store, buying and selling livestock, weaving shawls, lamb butchering, and making flower baskets. Cristina says this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the institution at the invitation of the facilitator in the area.

Currently she has a business buying and selling livestock, that she has been doing for many years. The loan she will take out is for increasing her capital, by buying livestock that she will acquire at fairs in the rural area, and later sell in her community. This work will allow her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has eleven children.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 26 años, es una mujer trabajadora, dinámica y muy sociable, es separada, pero vive en compañía de su pequeño hijo de 4 años, a quien quiere mucho y es el motivo para seguir esforzándose. Juntos habitan en una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad a la que se dedica Lizbeth, es la venta de productos Unión, productos comestibles como: galletas, pan integral, pionono, mermeladas, entre otros. En este negocio cuenta con la ayuda de una amiga, quien es la encargada de traer estos productos desde la ciudad de Lima para luego ofertarlos y muchas veces venderlos a crédito a empleados de las diferentes empresas de su ciudad. Tiene dos años dedicandose a este trabajo, y lo que le gusta es tener un ingreso económico, con ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que actualmente no cuenta con ningún apoyo, siendo padre y madre para su hijo. Durante este tiempo de trabajo, manifiesta que la desventaja que tiene es hay ocasiones que sus clientes no le pagan y eso le perjudica en sus ganancias. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad que le han brindado anteriormente y ahora espera nuevamente su apoyo. Con el dinero que solicita, los invertirá en la compra de más productos Unión.
texts.en: Lizbeth is 26 years old. She is a hard-working, dynamic and very sociable woman. She is separated but lives together with her 4-year-old son who she loves very much. He is her motivation for continuing to work hard. They live together in a house which she owns. Lizbeth's business is selling Unión-brand products. These are food products such as cookies, wholewheat bread, piononos, jams, etc. In this business she has the help of a friend who takes care of transporting these products from the city of Lima so that she can sell them (often on credit) to employees in different companies in the city. Lizbeth has been in this line of work for two years and what she likes is having an income which she can use to cover her household expenses as she currently has no support, being both mother and father to her son. She tells us that the downside to her work is that there are times when her customers don't pay her and this affects her profits. This will be Lizbeth's fourth loan from MFP. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunities that she has been given in the past and now she is once again hoping for your support. She will invest the money that she has requested in buying more Unión-brand products.

loans.use: to buy more cookies, wholewheat bread and other products

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rosa tiene 49 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio el cual es la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, vive en el caserio la Cuchilla, ahi tiene vaR. clientes que le prefieren porque la calidad de los productos que vende es buena y los precios son accesibles para las personas que viven en dicho caserio.
Rosa todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para atender a su familia y luego abre su negocio para atender a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frijoles, azucar, manteca, arroz, tortillas, refrescos, jugos, aceite, candelas, fosforos, churros, sopas, condimentos, huevos, cereal, avena, confites, cafe, pan, galletas y otros productos.
Rosa es madre de 3 hijos, los  cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.
Rosa en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa, age 49, is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business of selling everyday consumer products. She has a store inside of her home in the village of Cuchilla. Rosa has several customers in this village who prefer to do business with her because of the good quality of the products she sells and the affordable prices. She wakes up every day at 4am so that she can attend to her family before opening her business to her customers.

This loan will be used to buy beans, sugar, lard, rice, tortillas, soft drinks, juices, oil, candles, matches, donuts, soups, condiments, eggs, cereal, oats, candy, coffee, bread, cookies, and other products. Rosa is the mother of three children who attend school in the community. In her free time, she raises chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Los Almendros Del Coyolar Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Almendros del Coyolar está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras uno de ellos es el señor José Mauricio de 42 años propietario de una pulpería desde hace 15 años. El invertirá el crédito en arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite...etc.
Los otros integrantes son Francisco Antonio de 30 años quien se dedica a la venta de verduras, Luisa María de 39 años vende pan en el mercado desde hace 15 años y Juana vende enchiladas y helados.
texts.en:
The “Los Almendros del Coyolar” is composed of four hardworking people.  One of them is José Mauricio, 42, who has owned a grocery store for the last 15 years.  He will use his loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, etc.

The other group members are Francisco Antonio, 30, who sells vegetables, Luisa María, 39, who has sold bread in the market for the last 15 years and Juana who sells enchiladas and ice-cream.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Ana Cecilia; es  conviviente, la socia tiene 24 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,ella sigue teniendo terrenos de cultivo donde siembra maiz,papa,trigo y cebada y tambien ahora tienen un carro que hace servicio de taxi,este trabajo lo realiza su esposo y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar sus negocios de agricultura y servicio de taxi. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo y tambien pra el mentenimiento de su carro.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en: Ana Cecilia, 24, has a spouse and two children.  She continues working in farming.  She still has farmland where she grows corn, potatoes, wheat and barley but she now also has a car that provides taxi services; her husband does this latter work and together they support their children.  She wants to expand and improve her farming and taxi businesses and is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for the fields and also to service her car.  She is very grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and also to service her car.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es: El señor Gerónimo nacido  en Potosí el es soltero, se dedica a la agricultura en alto Villa Barrientos distante a 32 km de la localidad de Santa Rita, donde tiene su parcela en la cual vive y trabaja, el siembra: maíz, yuca, papa y poroto, pero el mas se dedica a la siembra de yuca, como la  distancia es mucha para transportarse  de Santa Rita hasta su parcela ha solicitado un  crédito,  el cual esta destinado para la compra de una motocicleta, para trasladarse de un lugar al otro, esto ayudándolo mucho, es el  primer crédito que esta sacando. Por cual se siente muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Gerónimo was born in Potosí.  He’s single and is a farmer in Alto Villa Barrientos which is 32 kilometers from Santa Rita.  He has his parcel of land there that he farms.  He grows corn, cassava, potatoes and beans but mostly cassava.  Because the distance between Santa Rosa and his parcel is long he’s asked for a a loan to buy a motorcycle to get from place to place.  This would help him a lot.  It’s the first loan he’s taken out so he feels very grateful to the institution for the support it’s provided him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, awnings and pots to hire out

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
